bands.name: Phil Campbell And The Bastard Sons
Phil Campbel & The Bastard Sons – Plays Motorhead
Within Temptation
bands.description: Within Temptation is a Dutch symphonic metal band formed in 1996 by vocalist Sharon den Adel and guitarist Robert Westerholt. Known for their powerful vocals, orchestral arrangements, and atmospheric soundscapes, the band has released several successful albums, including 'Mother Earth,' 'The Silent Force,' and 'Hydra.' Within Temptation's music often explores themes of fantasy, nature, and personal struggles, resonating with a wide audience. They have toured extensively worldwide and are celebrated for their captivating live performances that blend rock and classical elements.

bands.name: In Flames
bands.description: In Flames is a Swedish metal band formed in Gothenburg in 1990. They are considered pioneers of the melodic death metal genre, blending aggressive riffs with melodic elements and introspective lyrics. Over the years, In Flames has evolved their sound, incorporating alternative and modern metal influences, which has garnered them a diverse fanbase worldwide. Known for their energetic live performances and influential albums like 'The Jester Race' and 'Clayman,' In Flames continues to be a significant force in the metal scene.

bands.name: Annisokay
bands.description: Annisokay is a German post-hardcore band formed in 2007 in Halle, Saxony-Anhalt. The band initially released two demo CDs, 'My Ticket to Reno' in 2008 and 'The Point You Will Still Miss' in 2009. In 2010, they produced their first official EP, 'You, Always', which included a cover of Lady Gaga's 'Telephone'. Their debut album, 'The Lucid Dream[er]', was self-released in 2012 and re-released in 2014 under SPV GmbH. The follow-up album, 'Enigmatic Smile', released in March 2015, peaked at number 68 on the German Albums Chart. In 2018, they released 'Arms', which reached number 26 on the German Albums Chart. Their fifth studio album, 'Aurora', released in January 2021, debuted at number 18 on the German Albums Chart. The band has undergone lineup changes over the years, with Rudi Schwarzer joining as the unclean vocalist in 2019, Christoph Wieczorek on clean vocals and guitar, Peter Leukhardt on bass, and Nico Vaeen on drums. Annisokay's music blends heavy guitar riffs, melodic vocals, and aggressive shouts, incorporating elements of pop, progressive metal, and EDM. Their lyrics often explore dark themes and social issues.

bands.name: Gutalax
bands.description: Gutalax is a Czech goregrind band formed in 2009 in Křemže. The band was established by members Martin "Maty" Matoušek, Pavel "Kebab" Troup, Tomáš "Kojas" Anderle, and Petr "Mr. Free" Svoboda. Their name is derived from the laxative Guttalax, reflecting their humorous and provocative style. In September 2009, they recorded seven tracks for their debut album, which was released as a split with the Italian band Cannibe. Their first full-length album, "Shit Beast," was recorded in January 2011 and released on the Czech label Bizarre Leprous Production. In early 2014, they recorded their second album, "Shit Happens," which was released in 2015 on the German label Rotten Roll Rex. In 2021, they released their third album, "The Shitpendables," again via Rotten Roll Rex. The band describes their musical style as "gore 'n' roll," consisting of a mix of goregrind and pornogrind with a dose of humor. Their songs generally deal with feces and sex. The current lineup includes Martin "Maty" Matoušek on vocals, Pavel "Kebab" Troup on bass, Tomáš "Kojas" Anderle on guitar, and Petr "Mr. Free" Svoboda on drums.

bands.name: Dödsrit
bands.description: Dödsrit is a Swedish black metal band formed in 2017 by Christoffer Öster, the former guitarist of the hardcore punk band Totem Skin. Initially conceived as a solo project, Dödsrit evolved into a full band in 2018, incorporating members from the Netherlands. The band's music is characterized by a fusion of atmospheric black metal and raw crust punk, creating a sound that is both intense and melancholic. Their debut self-titled album was released in 2017, followed by "Spirit Crusher" in 2018, "Mortal Coil" in 2021, and "Nocturnal Will" in 2024. The latter album showcases the band's evolution, blending black metal with traditional metal influences and expansive song structures. Notable tracks include "Apathetic Tongues," "Shallow Graves," and "A Drowning Voice." Dödsrit has performed at prominent festivals such as Brutal Assault and Roadburn, and they are set to embark on a North American tour in November 2025.

bands.name: Esoteric
bands.description: Esoteric is a British funeral doom metal band from Birmingham, formed in 1992. They are widely regarded as pioneers of the funeral doom subgenre, known for their atmospheric and experimental approach to doom metal. Their music is characterized by slow tempos, deep growls, and a dense, immersive sound. The band has released seven studio albums, including "Epistemological Despondency" (1994), "The Pernicious Enigma" (1997), "Metamorphogenesis" (1999), "Subconscious Dissolution into the Continuum" (2004), "The Maniacal Vale" (2008), "Paragon of Dissonance" (2011), and "A Pyrrhic Existence" (2019). They have also released a demo titled "Esoteric Emotions - The Death of Ignorance" in 1993. Esoteric's music often explores themes of misanthropy, hopelessness, infinity, space, dreams, isolation, and psychedelia. The current lineup includes Greg Chandler (vocals, guitar), Mark Bodossian (bass), Joe Fletcher (drums), and Mathew Barnes (guitar). They are currently signed to Season of Mist. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Esoteric_%28band%29))

bands.name: Judas Priest
bands.description: Judas Priest is a seminal English heavy metal band formed in Birmingham in 1969. Pioneers of the New Wave of British Heavy Metal (NWOBHM), they have sold over 50 million albums worldwide. Their influential sound has shaped various metal subgenres, including speed, thrash, and power metal. The band's iconic twin-guitar attack, led by Glenn Tipton and K.K. Downing, and the powerful vocals of Rob Halford, have been central to their success. Notable albums include 'Sad Wings of Destiny' (1976), 'British Steel' (1980), and 'Painkiller' (1990). In 2024, they released their nineteenth studio album, 'Invincible Shield', and celebrated the 35th anniversary of 'Painkiller' with special performances. The current lineup features Rob Halford (vocals), Glenn Tipton (guitars), Ian Hill (bass), Scott Travis (drums), and Richie Faulkner (guitars).

bands.name: Black Spiders
bands.description: Black Spiders are an English rock band formed in Sheffield in 2008. Known for their energetic performances and hard-hitting sound, they draw influences from classic rock bands such as Black Sabbath, Motörhead, and AC/DC. The band's debut album, "Sons of the North," was released in 2011, followed by "This Savage Land" in 2013. After a brief hiatus, they returned in 2020 with new drummer Wyatt Wendels and released "Can't Die, Won't Die" in 2023. Their fifth studio album, "Cvrses," was released in February 2025, featuring tracks like "Never Enough" and "Cool Reaper."

bands.name: Gorillaz
bands.description: Gorillaz is a British virtual band formed in 1998 by musician Damon Albarn and artist Jamie Hewlett. The band comprises four animated members: 2-D (vocals, keyboards), Murdoc Niccals (bass guitar), Noodle (guitar, keyboards, vocals), and Russel Hobbs (drums). Their music blends alternative rock, electronic, trip hop, art pop, and hip-hop, resulting in a distinctive and innovative sound. Gorillaz debuted with their self-titled album in 2001, featuring the hit single "Clint Eastwood," which propelled them into international fame. Their second album, "Demon Days" (2005), achieved critical acclaim and commercial success, with the single "Feel Good Inc." topping charts worldwide. Over the years, Gorillaz has released multiple albums, including "Plastic Beach" (2010), "Humanz" (2017), "The Now Now" (2018), "Song Machine, Season One: Strange Timez" (2020), and "Cracker Island" (2023). The band is known for its eclectic collaborations with artists like De La Soul, Elton John, and Bad Bunny. In 2025, they celebrated their 25th anniversary with the "House of Kong" exhibition in London and a special performance at the Pulse of Gaia Festival in Madrid. The band's unique blend of genres and virtual personas has solidified their status as pioneers in the music industry.

bands.name: Caliban
bands.description: Caliban is a German metalcore band formed in Essen in 1997. Originally known as Never Again, the band underwent several lineup changes before settling on its current members. Their music is characterized by a blend of aggressive metalcore riffs, melodic elements, and introspective lyrics. Over the years, Caliban has released numerous studio albums, including "A Small Boy and a Grey Heaven" (1999), "Vent" (2001), "Shadow Hearts" (2003), "The Opposite from Within" (2004), "The Undying Darkness" (2006), "The Awakening" (2007), "Say Hello to Tragedy" (2009), "I Am Nemesis" (2012), "Ghost Empire" (2014), "Gravity" (2016), "Elements" (2018), "Zeitgeister" (2021), and "Dystopia" (2022). Their upcoming album, "Back From Hell," is scheduled for release on April 25, 2025. ([calibanmetal.com](https://calibanmetal.com/news-detail/32.html)) The band's lineup consists of Andreas Dörner (vocals), Marc Görtz (lead guitar), Denis Schmidt (rhythm guitar), Patrick Grün (drums), and Kenneth Iain Duncan (bass, clean vocals). ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/bands/Caliban/3540331819))

bands.name: Lone Survivors
bands.description: Lone Survivors is a French progressive metalcore band formed in 2019. The band emerged with a distinctive sound that blends metalcore, djent, and progressive metal elements, creating a dynamic and groove-oriented musical experience. Their debut album, "Ground Zero," released in 2019, showcases their technical prowess and compositional depth, featuring complex structures and atmospheric passages. In 2024, they released their EP "Run 1," further solidifying their presence in the metalcore scene. The band's lineup includes vocalist Tapio Wilska (ex-Finntroll), guitarist Samuel Ruotsalainen (ex-Finntroll, Shape of Despair), guitarist Sam Jamsen, bassist Kimmo Tukiainen (Hanging Garden, Diablerie), and drummer Jan-Erik Kari (Fear of Domination).

bands.name: Thundermother
bands.description: Thundermother is an all-female Swedish hard rock band formed in 2009 by guitarist Filippa Nässil in Växjö. The band has undergone several lineup changes over the years but has consistently delivered energetic rock music. Their debut album, "Rock N Roll Disaster," was released in 2014, followed by "Road Fever" in 2015. In 2018, they released their self-titled third album, "Thundermother," which marked the debut of vocalist Guernica Mancini. The band's fourth album, "Heat Wave," released in 2020, achieved significant success, reaching number six on the German charts and number eight in Sweden. Their fifth album, "Black and Gold," released in 2022, continued their upward trajectory, securing top positions in European charts. In 2023, the band underwent another lineup change, with vocalist Guernica Mancini, drummer Emlee Johansson, and bassist Mona Lindgren departing. They were replaced by vocalist Linnéa Vikström, bassist Majsan Lindberg, and drummer Joan Massing. The band's latest album, "Dirty and Divine," was released in February 2025, showcasing their resilience and commitment to rock music. ([metalexpressradio.com](https://www.metalexpressradio.com/2025/02/02/thundermother-dirty-divine/))

bands.name: Cold Snap
bands.description: Cold Snap is a Croatian modern metal band formed in Varaždin in 2003. Initially blending nu metal and groove metal, they have evolved to incorporate elements of melodic death metal and thrash metal into their sound. The band has released four studio albums: "Empty Promises" (2008), "Perfection" (2010), "World War 3" (2013), and "All Our Sins" (2018). Notably, "Perfection" and "World War 3" were produced by renowned Danish producer Tue Madsen, known for his work with bands like Meshuggah and Behemoth. Cold Snap has toured extensively across Europe, sharing stages with acts such as Pro-Pain, Dead By April, Ektomorf, Limp Bizkit, Soulfly, Disturbed, Blind Guardian, Darkest Hour, and Suicide Silence. They have performed at major festivals including Wacken Open Air, Metal Camp, Metal Fest, and Metal Days. In 2017, the band signed with Arising Empire, a division of Nuclear Blast Records, and released "All Our Sins" in 2018. Their music is characterized by a powerful fusion of heavy metal and groove metal, captivating listeners with aggressive riffs and dynamic vocals.

bands.name: Helloween
bands.description: Helloween is a German power metal band formed in 1984 in Hamburg. They are often credited as pioneers of the power metal genre, blending elements of speed metal and traditional heavy metal. The original lineup included guitarist and vocalist Kai Hansen, bassist Markus Grosskopf, guitarist Michael Weikath, and drummer Ingo Schwichtenberg. Their early work, such as the 1985 EP "Helloween," showcased their energetic style and set the stage for their future success. In 1987, they released "Keeper of the Seven Keys: Part I," followed by "Part II" in 1988, both of which are considered classics in the genre. The band's lineup has evolved over the years, with notable members like vocalist Michael Kiske and guitarist Roland Grapow contributing to their distinctive sound. In 2021, Helloween released their sixteenth studio album, "Helloween," marking the return of Hansen and Kiske. Their latest album, "Giants & Monsters," was released on August 29, 2025, continuing their legacy in the power metal scene. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Helloween))

bands.name: Bury Tomorrow
bands.description: Bury Tomorrow is a British metalcore band formed in 2006 in Southampton, Hampshire, England. The band consists of lead vocalist Daniel Winter-Bates, bassist Davyd Winter-Bates, drummer Adam Jackson, lead guitarist Kristan Dawson, rhythm guitarist Ed Hartwell, and keyboardist/vocalist Tom Prendergast. They have released eight studio albums, with their most recent, "Will You Haunt Me, With That Same Patience," set to release on May 16, 2025. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bury_Tomorrow))

bands.name: Metal Church
bands.description:
Formed in 1980 in San Francisco, California, Metal Church is a seminal American heavy metal band that has significantly influenced the thrash, speed, and power metal genres. The original lineup featured guitarist Kurdt Vanderhoof, vocalist William McKay, lead guitarist Rick "Chief" Condrin, bassist Steve Hott, and drummer Rick Wagner. After relocating to Aberdeen, Washington, the band rebranded as Shrapnel before returning to the Metal Church name in 1982. Their self-titled debut album, released in 1984, showcased their thrash metal prowess and set the stage for their rise in the metal scene. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metal_Church_%28album%29))

Throughout the 1980s, Metal Church released several influential albums, including "The Dark" (1986) and "Blessing in Disguise" (1989), the latter marking the debut of vocalist Mike Howe. The band's lineup experienced changes over the years, with Vanderhoof being the consistent member. After a hiatus in the late 1990s, Metal Church reformed in 2003, releasing "The Weight of the World" in 2004. Tragically, vocalist Mike Howe passed away in 2021, but the band continued with new vocalist Marc Lopes, releasing "Congregation of Annihilation" in 2023. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metal_Church))

Metal Church is renowned for their tight musicianship and thought-provoking lyrics, often addressing societal issues, inner struggles, and philosophical themes. Their contributions have solidified their status as pioneers in the American heavy metal scene.

bands.name: Arch Enemy
bands.description: Arch Enemy is a Swedish melodic death metal band formed in 1995 in Halmstad. Founded by guitarist Michael Amott, the band has undergone several lineup changes over the years. Their music is characterized by aggressive guitar riffs, melodic elements, and powerful vocals. They have released several albums, including "Black Earth" (1996), "Stigmata" (1998), "Burning Bridges" (1999), "Wages of Sin" (2001), "Anthems of Rebellion" (2003), "Doomsday Machine" (2005), "Rise of the Tyrant" (2007), "Khaos Legions" (2011), "War Eternal" (2014), "Will to Power" (2017), "Deceivers" (2022), and "Blood Dynasty" (2025). ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arch_Enemy))

bands.name: The Cure
bands.description: The Cure are an English rock band formed in Crawley, West Sussex, in 1976. Initially known as Easy Cure, the band underwent several lineup changes, with Robert Smith (vocals, guitar) being the constant member and primary creative force. They gained prominence in the late 1980s and early 1990s with albums like "Disintegration" (1989) and "Wish" (1992), which featured hits such as "Lullaby," "Lovesong," and "Friday I'm in Love." Their music is characterized by a blend of gothic rock, post-punk, and new wave elements, often exploring themes of melancholy and existentialism. In 2024, they released "Songs of a Lost World," their first studio album in 16 years, which topped the UK Albums Chart, marking their first number one album in the UK since 1992. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Cure))

bands.name: Baby Metal
bands.description:
Babymetal is a Japanese band formed in Tokyo in 2010, known for their unique fusion of heavy metal and J-pop, a genre often referred to as "kawaii metal." The group initially began as a sub-unit of the idol group Sakura Gakuin, featuring Suzuka Nakamoto as "Su-metal" (lead vocals, dancing) and Moa Kikuchi as "Moametal" (backing vocals, dancing). In 2013, they became an independent act following Su-metal's departure from Sakura Gakuin. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Babymetal))

Their self-titled debut album, "Babymetal," was released in 2014, featuring tracks that date back to their origins in 2010. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Babymetal_%28album%29)) Over the years, Babymetal has released several albums, including "Metal Resistance" (2016), "Metal Galaxy" (2019), and "The Other One" (2023). In 2025, they released "Metal Forth," celebrating their 15th anniversary with collaborations from artists like Poppy, Electric Callboy, Slaughter to Prevail, Bloodywood, Polyphia, Spiritbox, and Tom Morello. ([metalforth.com](https://www.metalforth.com/))

In 2024, Momoko Okazaki joined as "Momometal," completing the current lineup. The band's energetic performances and distinctive style have garnered a global fanbase, with notable achievements such as headlining and selling out the O2 Arena in London in May 2025. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Babymetal))

bands.name: Social Distortion
bands.description: Social Distortion is an American punk rock band formed in 1978 in Fullerton, California. The band was founded by Mike Ness, who serves as the lead vocalist and guitarist. Over the years, Social Distortion has undergone several lineup changes, with Ness being the only constant member. The current lineup includes Jonny "2 Bags" Wickersham on rhythm guitar and backing vocals, Brent Harding on bass and backing vocals, and David Hidalgo Jr. on drums and percussion. The band's music is characterized by a blend of punk rock, cowpunk, and roots rock, with early influences from hardcore punk. Their sound has evolved over time, incorporating elements of country, blues, and early rock and roll. Social Distortion has released seven full-length studio albums, including "Mommy's Little Monster" (1983), "Prison Bound" (1988), "Social Distortion" (1990), "Somewhere Between Heaven and Hell" (1992), "White Light, White Heat, White Trash" (1996), "Sex, Love and Rock 'n' Roll" (2004), and "Hard Times and Nursery Rhymes" (2011). The band's 1990 self-titled album was certified gold by the RIAA and includes the hit singles "Ball and Chain" and "Story of My Life." Social Distortion continues to tour and record music, maintaining a dedicated fan base and influencing numerous punk and rock bands.

bands.name: Alter Bridge
bands.description: Alter Bridge is an American rock band formed in 2004 in Orlando, Florida, by vocalist and guitarist Myles Kennedy, lead guitarist Mark Tremonti, bassist Brian Marshall, and drummer Scott Phillips. The band emerged after the members' previous group, Creed, became inactive in 2003. Their debut album, "One Day Remains," released in 2004, showcased a blend of hard rock and alternative metal, setting the tone for their future sound. The follow-up, "Blackbird" (2007), received critical acclaim for its depth and complexity. In 2010, they released "AB III," which delved into darker themes and featured the hit single "Isolation." The band's subsequent albums, including "Fortress" (2013), "The Last Hero" (2016), and "Walk the Sky" (2019), continued to evolve their sound, incorporating elements of progressive metal and post-grunge. In 2022, they released "Pawns & Kings," which debuted at number one on the US Hard Music Albums chart. Their upcoming self-titled eighth studio album is scheduled for release on January 9, 2026, via Napalm Records. Known for their memorable riffs, infectious vocal melodies, and dueling guitar attack, Alter Bridge has garnered massive critical and fan acclaim worldwide. ([alterbridge.com](https://alterbridge.com/))

bands.name: Betontod
bands.description: Betontod is a German punk rock band formed in Rheinberg in 1990. Initially named Extrem, they later became Sniffin' Kills before settling on Betontod. The band has released multiple studio albums, including "Hier kommt Ärger!" (1999), "Stoppt uns wenn Ihr könnt!" (2001), "Schwarzes Blut" (2006), "GlaubeLiebeHoffnung" (2010), "Antirockstars" (2011), "Entschuldigung für Nichts" (2012), "Traum von Freiheit" (2015), "Revolution" (2017), "Vamos!" (2018), and "Pace Per Sempre" (2021). Their music blends elements of punk rock, rock, and metal, characterized by energetic performances and socially conscious lyrics. The band has been a significant presence in the German music scene, performing at major festivals like Wacken Open Air and With Full Force. They are known for their dynamic live shows and have a dedicated fan base. ([de.wikipedia.org](https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Betontod))

bands.name: Marilyn Manson
bands.description: Marilyn Manson is an American rock band formed in 1989 in Fort Lauderdale, Florida, by lead vocalist Marilyn Manson (born Brian Hugh Warner) and guitarist Daisy Berkowitz. The band's name is a combination of actress Marilyn Monroe and cult leader Charles Manson, reflecting their provocative and controversial image. Marilyn Manson's music blends industrial rock, industrial metal, gothic rock, and alternative metal, characterized by dark, theatrical performances and confrontational lyrics. Their early works, such as "Portrait of an American Family" (1994) and "Antichrist Superstar" (1996), established their reputation with hits like "The Beautiful People" and "Tourniquet." Over the years, the lineup has evolved, with Manson being the sole constant member. The band's twelfth studio album, "One Assassination Under God – Chapter 1," was released on November 22, 2024, marking a return to their industrial roots. The album features tracks like "One Assassination Under God," "No Funeral Without Applause," and "As Sick As The Secrets Within." To support the album, Marilyn Manson embarked on the "One Assassination Under God Tour," which began in August 2024 and is scheduled to conclude in December 2025, covering North America, Europe, South America, and Asia. The tour showcases a blend of classic hits and new material, reflecting the band's evolution while maintaining their signature dark aesthetic.

bands.name: Any Given Day
bands.description: Any Given Day is a German metalcore band formed in 2012 in Gelsenkirchen, North Rhine-Westphalia. The lineup consists of lead vocalist Dennis Diehl, lead guitarist Andy Posdziech, rhythm guitarist Dennis ter Schmitten, bassist Michael Golinski, and drummer Leon Stiller. The band debuted with a self-titled three-track demo in October 2012, which was re-recorded for their first full-length album, "My Longest Way Home," released in September 2014 via Redfield Records. The album peaked at No. 28 on the German album charts. They followed up with "Everlasting" in 2016, which reached No. 14, and "Overpower" in 2019, which peaked at No. 19. In 2024, they released "Limitless," which peaked at No. 33. Their music blends metalcore with elements of deathcore, djent, and groove metal, characterized by heavy riffs, melodic passages, and dynamic vocals. In November 2023, they collaborated with Annisokay on the single "H.A.T.E.", and in 2024, they released the single "Adrenaline." ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Any_Given_Day))

bands.name: Kublai Khan Tx
bands.description:
Kublai Khan TX is an American metalcore band from Sherman, Texas, formed in 2009. The group emerged when vocalist Matt Honeycutt and guitarist Nolan Ashley began channeling local hardcore influences into heavy, groove-forward music. They were soon joined by bassist Eric English and drummer Isaac Lamb. The band's name includes 'TX' to distinguish themselves from the historical figure Kublai Khan and to honor their Texan roots. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kublai_Khan_%28band%29))

Their debut album, "Balancing Survival & Happiness," was released in 2014 under Artery Recordings. This was followed by "New Strength" in 2015, "Nomad" in 2017, "Absolute" in 2019, and "Exhibition of Prowess" in 2024. The band has also released an EP titled "Lowest Form of Animal" in 2022. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kublai_Khan_%28band%29))

Kublai Khan TX's music is characterized by a blend of metalcore and beatdown hardcore, featuring aggressive breakdowns, groove-heavy riffs, and lyrics that confront struggle with blunt honesty. Their sound has drawn comparisons to bands like Hatebreed and Merauder. ([kublaikhantour.com](https://www.kublaikhantour.com/))

The current lineup includes Matt Honeycutt (vocals), Eric English (bass), Isaac Lamb (drums), and Nicholas Adams (guitar). ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kublai_Khan_%28band%29))

For more information, visit their official website at [kublaikhantx.com](https://www.kublaikhantx.com/).

bands.name: Animals As Leaders
bands.description:
Animals As Leaders is an American instrumental progressive metal band from Washington, D.C., formed in 2007 by guitarist Tosin Abasi. The project began as a solo endeavor following the disbandment of Abasi's previous band, Reflux. Prosthetic Records recognized Abasi's guitar work and encouraged him to create a solo album, leading to the release of their self-titled debut in 2009. The band's name was inspired by Daniel Quinn's 1992 novel 'Ishmael,' reflecting a reminder that humans are essentially animals. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Animals_as_Leaders))

The debut album showcased Abasi's technical prowess and innovative compositions, blending progressive metal with elements of jazz fusion and electronic music. In 2011, the band expanded to a trio with the addition of guitarist Javier Reyes and drummer Navene Koperweis, releasing 'Weightless,' which featured real drums alongside programmed ones. The album charted at No. 92 on the Billboard 200, marking a significant milestone for the band. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Weightless_%28Animals_as_Leaders_album%29))

Their third album, 'The Joy of Motion' (2014), debuted at No. 23 on the Billboard 200, reflecting their growing popularity. The album incorporated elements of electronic, Latin, and dance-pop, further diversifying their sound. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Joy_of_Motion)) In 2016, they released 'The Madness of Many,' followed by 'Parrhesia' in 2022, which was ranked as the 14th best guitar album of 2022 by Guitar World readers. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parrhesia_%28album%29))

Throughout their career, Animals As Leaders has been recognized for their technical proficiency and innovative approach to progressive metal, influencing a new generation of musicians and listeners.

bands.name: Enemy Inside
bands.description:
Enemy Inside is a German metal band formed in Aschaffenburg in 2017. The group was established by vocalist Nastassja Giulia and guitarist Evan K, who sought to create a unique sound blending dark rock and modern metal. Their music is characterized by powerful female vocals, aggressive arrangements, and catchy hooks, drawing comparisons to bands like Evanescence, Lacuna Coil, Amaranthe, Delain, and HIM.

In September 2018, Enemy Inside released their debut album, "Phoenix," under ROAR! Rock of Angels Records. The album featured singles such as "Falling Away," "Oblivion," and "Lullaby," with a guest appearance by Georg Neuhauser of Serenity on "Doorway to Salvation." "Phoenix" achieved notable success, reaching number 28 in the German iTunes Metal Top Releases and number 74 in the U.S.

Their second album, "Seven," was released in August 2021, peaking at number 93 on the German Download Charts and charting in several other countries. The album included singles like "Crystallize," "Alien," "Release Me," "Black Butterfly," and "In My Blood."

In February 2025, Enemy Inside released their third album, "Venom," through Reigning Phoenix Music. The album marked a significant evolution in their sound, incorporating heavier and more intricate elements, blending metalcore, industrial, and modern rock influences. The title track "Venom" was accompanied by a music video celebrating the album's release.

Throughout their career, Enemy Inside has performed at major festivals such as Wacken Open Air, Full Metal Cruise, Dynamo Metal Fest, Nummirock, M’era Luna, and Rockharz Open Air, and has toured extensively across Europe.

bands.name: Amorphis
bands.description: Amorphis is a Finnish progressive metal band formed in 1990 in Helsinki. Initially rooted in death metal, they have evolved to incorporate elements of progressive metal, melodic death metal, and folk metal. Their lyrics often draw inspiration from the Finnish epic poem, the Kalevala. The band has released several acclaimed albums, including "The Karelian Isthmus" (1992), "Tales from the Thousand Lakes" (1994), and "Queen of Time" (2018). Their 2018 album marked the return of original bassist Olli-Pekka Laine, reuniting the classic lineup. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Queen_of_Time))

bands.name: Testament
bands.description: Testament is an American thrash metal band formed in 1983 in Berkeley, California. Originally known as Legacy, the band changed its name to Testament in 1986. The current lineup includes rhythm guitarist Eric Peterson, lead vocalist Chuck Billy, lead guitarist Alex Skolnick, bassist Steve Di Giorgio, and drummer Chris Dovas. Testament is renowned for their technical precision and aggressive sound, contributing significantly to the thrash metal scene. Their discography includes fourteen studio albums, with their latest, "Para Bellum," released on October 10, 2025. The album blends thrash metal with elements of death and black metal, showcasing the band's evolving musical style. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Para_Bellum_%28album%29)) Throughout their career, Testament has been recognized for their influential role in thrash metal, with classics like "The Legacy" (1987) and "Practice What You Preach" (1989) solidifying their reputation. ([thisdayinmetal.com](https://www.thisdayinmetal.com/testaments-the-legacy-from-bay-area-beginnings-to-thrash-brilliance/))

bands.name: The Vintage Caravan
bands.description: Formed in 2006 in Álftanes, Iceland, The Vintage Caravan began as a duo with guitarist and vocalist Óskar Logi Ágústsson and drummer Guðjón Reynisson. They self-released their debut album in 2011, which led to a contract with the Icelandic label Sena. Shortly after, bassist Alexander Örn Númason joined, solidifying the trio's lineup. Their music blends classic hard rock from the 1960s and 1970s with a modern twist, drawing influences from bands like Led Zeppelin, Deep Purple, and Cream. Over the years, they've released several albums, including "Voyage" (2014), "Arrival" (2015), "Gateways" (2018), "Monuments" (2021), and their latest, "Portals," released on September 26, 2025, via Napalm Records. The band has toured extensively, performing at major festivals such as Wacken Open Air and Hellfest, and supporting acts like Opeth. Their dynamic live performances have garnered them a dedicated fanbase worldwide.

bands.name: Rotting Christ
bands.description: Formed in Athens in 1987, Rotting Christ is a pioneering force in the black metal scene, renowned for their unique blend of melodic black metal and gothic elements. Initially starting as a grindcore act, they evolved their sound, drawing influences from bands like Celtic Frost and Venom, and became one of the early adopters of black metal in Greece. Their 1991 EP, "Passage to Arcturo," marked a significant milestone, showcasing their distinctive style. Over the years, Rotting Christ has released numerous influential albums, including "Thy Mighty Contract" (1993), "Non Serviam" (1994), "Triarchy of the Lost Lovers" (1996), "A Dead Poem" (1997), and "Sleep of the Angels" (1999). Their 2019 album, "The Heretics," continued their tradition of blending dark, atmospheric melodies with profound thematic content. In 2024, they announced their latest album, "Pro Xristory," further solidifying their status in the metal community. ([metalplanetmusic.com](https://metalplanetmusic.com/2024/01/rotting-christ-announce-new-album-pro-xristory/)) The band's lineup has remained consistent with brothers Sakis Tolis (vocals and guitar) and Themis Tolis (drums) at the helm, supported by Kostas Spades (bass) and Kostis Foukarakis (guitar). ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rotting_Christ)) Their music often delves into themes of anti-Christianity, occultism, death, mythology, and Satanism, reflecting their deep engagement with dark and esoteric subjects. Rotting Christ's influence extends beyond Greece, having performed extensively across Europe, Asia, and the Americas, earning them a dedicated global fanbase. Their ability to evolve while maintaining their core essence has ensured their enduring presence in the metal scene.

bands.name: The Sisters Of Mercy
bands.description: The Sisters of Mercy are an English rock band formed in Leeds in 1980. Initially a post-punk outfit, they evolved into a pioneering force in gothic rock, characterized by dark, atmospheric soundscapes and introspective lyrics. The band's lineup has undergone numerous changes over the years, with Andrew Eldritch remaining the constant member. Their discography includes seminal albums such as "First and Last and Always" (1985), "Floodland" (1987), and "Vision Thing" (1990). "Floodland" features the iconic single "This Corrosion," which peaked at number 6 in Ireland, number 7 in the UK, and number 17 in Germany. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/This_Corrosion)) Despite periods of inactivity, the band continues to perform live, showcasing both classic tracks and new material. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Sisters_of_Mercy))

bands.name: Cryptopsy
bands.description: Cryptopsy is a Canadian technical death metal band formed in Montreal in 1988. Originally known as Necrosis, the band rebranded to Cryptopsy in 1992, aiming to explore heavier musical territories. Their debut album, "Blasphemy Made Flesh" (1994), showcased their intricate compositions and aggressive style, earning them a dedicated following in the death metal community. The 1996 release, "None So Vile," is often hailed as a seminal work in the genre, noted for its technical proficiency and brutal intensity. Over the years, Cryptopsy has undergone several lineup changes, with drummer Flo Mounier being the consistent member since 1992. The current lineup includes vocalist Matt McGachy, guitarist Christian Donaldson, bassist Olivier Pinard, and drummer Flo Mounier. Their 2023 album, "As Gomorrah Burns," marked their first full-length release in over a decade, followed by "An Insatiable Violence" in 2025, both receiving critical acclaim for their technical brutality and modernized sound. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptopsy))

bands.name: Manntra
bands.description: Manntra is a Croatian folk metal band formed in 2011 in Umag, Croatia. The band emerged after the disbandment of the industrial metal group Omega Lithium, with members Marko Matijević Sekul and Zoltan Lečei leading the formation of Manntra. They were soon joined by drummer Andrea Kert, and later by guitarist Dorian 'Dodo' Pavlović. Manntra's music is characterized by a fusion of traditional Croatian folk melodies with heavy metal, incorporating elements of industrial and electronic music. They often utilize traditional instruments such as the sopele, tamburica, and diple, alongside electric guitars, drums, and keyboards. The band's lyrics frequently explore themes of spirituality, mythology, and personal struggle, drawing inspiration from Croatian folklore and history. Their dynamic rhythms, driving guitar riffs, and powerful vocals have garnered them a dedicated following both within Croatia and internationally, particularly in Russia, Germany, and Austria. Manntra has released several albums, including "Horizont" (2012), "Venera" (2015), "Meridian" (2017), "Oyka!" (2019), "Monster Mind Consuming" (2021), "Kreatura" (2022), "Endlich! Live in Hamburg" (2022), "War of the Heathens" (2023), and "Titans" (2025). They have performed at major festivals such as Wacken Open Air and Rockharz Open Air, and have toured with bands like In Extremo. Their unique blend of folk and metal has established them as a distinctive presence in the metal scene.

bands.name: Jarhead Fertilizer
bands.description: Formed in 2011 in Ocean City, Maryland, Jarhead Fertilizer is a metal band known for their aggressive and visceral sound. Initially rooted in grindcore and powerviolence, their style has evolved to incorporate elements of death metal. The band's lyrical themes often explore topics such as misery, despair, death, crime, and urban decay. Their discography includes the EP "Opiate Conquest" (2015), the full-length album "Product of My Environment" (2021), and "Carceral Warfare" (2023). "Carceral Warfare" delves into personal experiences, particularly those of drummer/vocalist Dave Bland's late father, drawing inspiration from diverse influences like Mortal Decay, Lucifer’s Hammer, Demilich, and Memphis hip-hop act Three Six Mafia. ([live-metal.com](https://live-metal.com/2023/11/29/jarhead-fertilizer-shares-two-songs-from-upcoming-album-carceral-warfare/))

bands.name: P.O.D.
bands.description: P.O.D. (Payable on Death) is an American Christian nu metal band formed in 1992 in San Diego, California. The lineup consists of vocalist Sonny Sandoval, bassist Traa Daniels, lead guitarist Marcos Curiel, and drummer Wuv Bernardo. Over their career, they've sold over 12 million records worldwide and received three Grammy Award nominations. Their third studio album, "The Fundamental Elements of Southtown" (1999), achieved platinum certification, marking their mainstream breakthrough. The follow-up, "Satellite" (2001), went triple platinum, featuring hits like "Alive" and "Youth of the Nation." In 2003, Curiel departed due to personal differences, replaced by Jason Truby. Curiel rejoined in 2006, and the band released "When Angels & Serpents Dance" in 2008. Their tenth album, "Circles," was released in 2018. In 2021, Wuv Bernardo took a hiatus from the band. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/P.O.D.))

bands.name: Iotunn
bands.description: Iotunn is a progressive metal band formed in 2015 in Copenhagen, Denmark, by brothers Jesper and Jens Nicolai Gräs. Initially, the band explored progressive and space rock influences, but over time, their sound evolved into a blend of progressive melodic death metal. In 2018, vocalist Jón Aldará, known for his work with the Faroese band Hamferð, joined Iotunn, bringing a distinctive vocal style to their music. The lineup was further solidified in 2019 with the addition of bassist Eskil Rask, who also plays in Sunless Dawn. Iotunn's debut album, "Access All Worlds," was released on February 26, 2021, through Metal Blade Records. The album received critical acclaim for its intricate compositions and atmospheric depth. On October 25, 2024, the band released their second full-length album, "Kinship," which continues to showcase their evolving sound and thematic exploration. The album was praised for its expansive soundscapes and thematic depth, delving into themes of unity and disunity, light and dark, body and mind, nature and culture, good and evil, and creation and destruction. Iotunn's music is characterized by its atmospheric depth, intricate compositions, and thematic exploration, appealing to fans of progressive and melodic death metal.

bands.name: Alestorm
bands.description: Alestorm is a Scottish heavy metal band formed in Perth in 2004. Originally known as Battleheart, the band adopted a pirate theme after the success of their song "Heavy Metal Pirates," incorporating elements of folk metal into their music. Their debut album, "Captain Morgan's Revenge," was released in 2008, followed by "Black Sails at Midnight" in 2009, "Back Through Time" in 2011, "Sunset on the Golden Age" in 2014, "No Grave But the Sea" in 2017, "Curse of the Crystal Coconut" in 2020, "Seventh Rum of a Seventh Rum" in 2022, and "The Thunderfist Chronicles" in 2025. The band's music is characterized by pirate-themed lyrics, upbeat melodies, and the use of folk instruments like the keytar, tin whistle, and hurdy-gurdy. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alestorm))

bands.name: Neckbreakker
bands.description: Neckbreakker is a Danish death metal band formed in 2020 in Silkeborg, Denmark. The band consists of Christoffer Kofoed (vocals), Joakim Kaspersen and Johan Lundvig (guitars), Sebastian Knoblauch (bass), and Anton “Hajn” Bregendorf (drums). Initially known as Nakkeknaekker, they changed their name to Neckbreakker in 2024. In 2023, they released their debut demo, "Demo 2023," featuring tracks like "Crush Sionism," "Rats," and "The Flight of the P.U.M.A." The band gained significant attention after signing with Nuclear Blast Records and announcing their debut album, "Within The Viscera," set for release on December 6, 2024. The album includes tracks such as "Horizon Of Spikes," "Putrefied Body Fluid," "Shackled To A Corpse," "Nephilim," "Purgatory Rites," "Unholy Inquisition," "Absorption," "SILO," and "Face Splitting Madness." The lead single, "Horizon Of Spikes," was released in September 2024, followed by "Shackled To A Corpse" in October 2024. Neckbreakker's music is characterized by aggressive guitar riffs, intense drumming, and guttural vocals, embodying the raw energy of death metal. Their dynamic performances and commitment to the genre have quickly established them as a promising act in the metal scene.

bands.name: Grand Magus
bands.description: Grand Magus is a Swedish heavy metal band formed in 1996 in Stockholm. Initially known as Smack, the trio—vocalist and guitarist Janne "JB" Christoffersson, bassist Mats "Fox" Skinner, and drummer Fredrik "Trisse" Liefvendahl—changed their name to Grand Magus in 1999. Their self-titled debut album, released in 2001, showcased a blend of heavy and doom metal, drawing comparisons to Black Sabbath and Deep Purple. Over the years, Grand Magus has evolved their sound, incorporating elements of stoner metal and classic heavy metal. Notable albums include "Iron Will" (2008), "Hammer of the North" (2010), and "The Hunt" (2012). In 2012, Ludwig "Ludde" Witt replaced Liefvendahl on drums. The band's tenth studio album, "Sunraven," was released on October 18, 2024, through Nuclear Blast Records. The current lineup consists of Janne "JB" Christoffersson (vocals, guitar), Mats "Fox" Skinner (bass, backing vocals), and Ludwig "Ludde" Witt (drums).

bands.name: H-Blockx
bands.description: H-Blockx is a German rock band formed in Münster in 1991. The band's name is a tribute to the 1981 Irish hunger strikers of HM Prison Maze, colloquially called the 'H-Blocks', though Henning Wehland has stated the band is not political. They rose to prominence with their debut album, "Time to Move," released in 1994. The album achieved significant success, spending 62 weeks on the German album chart and selling over 750,000 copies worldwide, earning the band their first gold album. The music videos for "Risin' High" and "Move" received considerable airplay on MTV, and the band earned a nomination for "Best Breakthrough Artist" at the 1995 MTV Europe Music Awards. In 1999, the World Wrestling Federation contacted them to record a song, "Oh Hell Yeah," for wrestler Stone Cold Steve Austin. Between 1994 and 2012, H-Blockx released seven studio albums. In 2024, they celebrated the 30th anniversary of their debut album with a series of concerts and released "Fallout," their first new song in over a decade. In August 2025, they released "Straight Outta Nowhere," their first release under the label Solitary Man Records, founded by the band Donots. They announced the "Fillin' the Blank" tour in fall 2025, covering eleven stations in Germany and Switzerland. ([full-metal-mayrhofen.com](https://www.full-metal-mayrhofen.com/en/2024/11/08/h-blockx/))

bands.name: Versengold
bands.description: Versengold is a German folk rock band formed in 2003 in Bremen. Initially a hobby project, the band has evolved into a prominent act in the German folk scene, known for blending historical texts with modern folk elements. Their music features a range of styles, from instrumental pieces and drinking songs to ballads and socially critical songs. Over the years, Versengold has released several albums, including "Hoerensagen" (2005), "Allgebraeu" (2006), "Ketzerey" (2008), "Im Namen des Folkes" (2013), "Zeitlos" (2015), "Funkenflug" (2017), "Nordlicht" (2019), "Was kost die Welt" (2022), and "Lautes Gedenken" (2023). Their 2022 album "Was kost die Welt" reached number one on the German album charts. The band's lineup has seen changes over the years, with current members including Malte Hoyer (vocals, flute), Alexander Willms (violin, nyckelharpa, concertina), Florian Janoske (violin, mandolin), Daniel Gregory (guitar), Eike Otten (bass), and Sean Lang (drums, piano). ([de.wikipedia.org](https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Versengold))

bands.name: Terzij De Horde
bands.description:
Terzij De Horde is a Dutch black metal band from Utrecht, formed in 2010. Initially known as Liar Liar Cross On Fire, they evolved from grindcore and crusty hardcore roots to embrace a darker, atmospheric sound. Their music is characterized by intense live performances and themes of philosophy, constructs of self, and poetry.

Their discography includes:

- **A Rage of Rapture Against the Dying of the Light** (2010): Debut EP released under their former name.

- **A Chosen Hollow** (2012): Split 12" with fellow Dutch band Starve.

- **Self** (2015): Debut full-length album exploring themes of self and existence.

- **In One of These I Am Your Enemy** (2022): Second full-length album.

- **Van Grond** (2023): Split release with Ggu:ll.

- **Our Breath Is Not Ours Alone** (2025): Upcoming album scheduled for release on October 10, 2025. ([terzijdehorde.nl](https://terzijdehorde.nl/))

The band's lineup consists of:

- Joost Vervoort (vocals)

- Demian Snel (guitar)

- Jelle Agema (guitar)

- Johan van Hattum (bass)

- Richard Japenga (drums) ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Terzij_de_Horde))

Their music blends black metal with post-metal and post-hardcore influences, creating a unique and immersive listening experience.

([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Terzij_de_Horde))

bands.name: Brothers Of Metal
bands.description:
Brothers of Metal is a Swedish power metal band formed in 2012 in Falun. The band is known for its grand-scale fusion of metal, folk, rock, and pop, with massed vocals and guitars that set the stage for an over-the-top celebration of heroic legend and folklore. Their visual style and lyrics are inspired by Vikings and Norse mythology, often purposefully over-the-top, which earns them both criticism and praise. ([music.apple.com](https://music.apple.com/us/artist/brothers-of-metal/1145316099))

The band released their debut album, "Prophecy of Ragnarök," in November 2017. Their second album, "Emblas Saga," was released on January 10, 2020, and received positive reviews. The third studio album, "Fimbulvinter," was released on November 1, 2024. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brothers_of_Metal))

The band's lineup includes three vocalists (two male, one female), three guitarists, a bassist, and a drummer. Their names and roles are humorously described on the band's website as follows:

- Joakim Lindbäck Eriksson – "Battle Cries" (lead vocals)
- Ylva Eriksson – "Voice of the Valkyries" (lead vocals)
- Mats Nilsson – "Tongue of the Gods" (support vocals)
- Emil Wärmedal – "Lute of heavy thunder" (bass guitar)
- Pähr Nilsson – "Lute of lightning" (guitar)
- Dawid Grahn – "Lute of lightning" (guitar)
- Johan Johansson – "Anvil and War Drums" (drums)

In August 2023, guitarist Mikael Fehrm left the band due to medical issues. He had not been playing live shows for some time. Even after his departure, the band still acts as an octet on stage, with Christian Larsson added as live guitarist. He had been playing shows as a replacement for Fehrm since March 2022. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brothers_of_Metal))

The band's music is characterized by a thunderous, catchy mixture of power metal, irresistible melodies, heavy riffs, and some folkish elements, which they refer to as "True Heavy Metal." ([afm-records.com](https://www.afm-records.com/blogs/news/brothers-of-metal-sign-with-afm-records))

For more information, you can visit their official website at [brothersofmetal.net](https://www.brothersofmetal.net/).

bands.name: Bring Me The Horizon
bands.description: Formed in Sheffield, England, in 2004, Bring Me the Horizon began as a deathcore band with their debut album, "Count Your Blessings" (2006). They evolved their sound with "Suicide Season" (2008), incorporating elements of post-hardcore and electronic rock. Their third album, "There Is a Hell, Believe Me, I've Seen It. There Is a Heaven, Let's Keep It a Secret." (2010), debuted at number one on the UK Albums Chart. The band continued to diversify their style with "That's the Spirit" (2015), blending alternative metal and rock influences. In 2019, they released "Amo," which debuted at number one in 17 markets and earned a Grammy nomination for Best Rock Album. Their latest project, "Post Human: Nex Gen," was released in May 2024, showcasing their ongoing innovation in the rock genre. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bring_Me_the_Horizon))

bands.name: Biohazard
bands.description: Biohazard is an American hardcore band formed in Brooklyn, New York, in 1987. They are pioneers in blending hardcore punk and heavy metal with elements of hip hop, creating a distinctive sound that set them apart in the music scene. The original lineup consisted of bassist/vocalist Evan Seinfeld, guitarist Bobby Hambel, and drummer Anthony Meo. Guitarist/vocalist Billy Graziadei joined shortly after, and drummer Danny Schuler replaced Meo before the recording of their first album, solidifying the lineup from 1988 to 1995. Their self-titled debut album, released in 1990, addressed themes like gang wars, drugs, and violence in Brooklyn. In 1992, they signed with Roadrunner Records and released "Urban Discipline," which gained them international recognition. The band has undergone several lineup changes over the years, with Graziadei being the only constant member. After a hiatus, the classic lineup reunited in 2008 and released "Reborn in Defiance" in 2012. In 2025, they announced their first new album in over a decade, titled "Divided We Fall," with singles "Forsaken" and "F*** the System" released in June and July 2025, respectively.

bands.name: Visions Of Atlantis
bands.description: Visions of Atlantis is an Austrian symphonic metal band formed in 2000 in Bruck an der Mur, Styria. The band draws inspiration from the myth of Atlantis and the success of Finnish symphonic metal bands like Nightwish. Their music is characterized by a blend of symphonic and power metal elements, often incorporating pirate themes in recent works. The band's lineup has evolved over the years, with current members including Clémentine Delauney (vocals), Michele Guaitoli (vocals), Thomas Caser (drums), Christian Douscha (guitars), and Herbert Glos (bass). They have released several albums, such as "Eternal Endless Infinity" (2002), "Cast Away" (2004), "Trinity" (2007), "The Deep & the Dark" (2018), "Wanderers" (2019), "Pirates" (2022), and "Pirates II – Armada" (2024). Their music often explores themes of nautical tales, mythology, self-discovery, and love.

bands.name: Adept
bands.description: Adept is a Swedish metalcore band formed in 2004 in Trosa, Sweden. The current lineup includes vocalist Robert Ljung, guitarists Gustav Lithammer and Kasper Larcombe-Tronstad, bassist Filip Brandelius, and drummer Gabriel Hellmark. The band has released four studio albums: 'Another Year of Disaster' (2009), 'Death Dealers' (2011), 'Silence the World' (2013), and 'Sleepless' (2016). After a hiatus, Adept returned in 2024 with a 20th-anniversary show at Corefest in Stuttgart, Germany. In 2025, they announced their fifth studio album, 'Blood Covenant,' set for release on October 24, 2025, via Napalm Records. The album features eleven tracks, including singles like 'Heaven,' 'You,' and 'Ignore the Sun.' ([distortedsoundmag.com](https://distortedsoundmag.com/adept-announce-new-album-blood-covenant/)) Adept is known for their high-energy performances and has shared stages with bands like A Day To Remember, Underoath, and Bring Me The Horizon. ([heavymag.com.au](https://heavymag.com.au/adept-return-after-nine-years-with-heaven/))

bands.name: Triptykon
bands.description: Triptykon is a Swiss extreme metal band formed in 2008 by Thomas Gabriel Fischer, the founder of Hellhammer and Celtic Frost. The band's music is characterized by a fusion of doom, gothic, black, and death metal elements, creating a dark and atmospheric sound. Their debut album, "Eparistera Daimones," released in 2010, received critical acclaim for its depth and intensity. The follow-up, "Melana Chasmata," released in 2014, further solidified their reputation in the metal community. In 2023, Triptykon announced they were working on their fourth studio album, with plans for its release in 2025. ([blabbermouth.net](https://blabbermouth.net/news/triptykon-is-working-on-long-awaited-new-album))

members.name: Thomas Gabriel Fischer
members.role: Lead And Backing Vocals, Rhythm Guitar, Programming

members.name: V. Santura
members.role: Lead And Backing Vocals, Lead Guitar

bands.name: The Browning
bands.description: The Browning is an American electronicore band formed in Kansas City, Missouri, in 2005. Initially a solo project by vocalist Jonny McBee, the band evolved into a full ensemble in 2010, incorporating drummer Noah Robertson, guitarist Brian Cravey, and bassist Jesse Glidewell. Their music uniquely blends elements of deathcore and metalcore with electronic genres such as hardstyle, trance, electronica, and dubstep, creating a distinctive sound characterized by double-bass drumming, 808s, and chugging guitar riffs. Lyrically, The Browning explores themes ranging from science fiction to positive messages. They have released six studio albums: "Burn This World" (2011), "Hypernova" (2013), "Isolation" (2016), "Geist" (2018), "End of Existence" (2021), and "OMNI" (2024). The band has toured extensively, sharing stages with acts like Electric Callboy, Static-X, Fear Factory, and We Came As Romans. In 2025, they released a heavy cover of Eiffel 65's "Blue (Da Ba Dee)". ([originalrock.net](https://originalrock.net/2025/01/06/the-browning-kicks-off-2025-with-a-hard-cover-of-eiffel-65s-blue-da-ba-dee/))

bands.name: Dark Tranquillity
bands.description: Dark Tranquillity is a pioneering Swedish melodic death metal band formed in Gothenburg in 1989. They are considered one of the founding acts of the Gothenburg metal scene, alongside bands like In Flames and At the Gates. The band's early lineup included vocalist Anders Fridén, who was later replaced by guitarist Mikael Stanne. Their debut album, "Skydancer," released in 1993, showcased their unique blend of aggression and melody, establishing them as a significant force in the metal scene. This album was the last recorded with Fridén before Stanne took over as lead vocalist. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Skydancer_%28Dark_Tranquillity_album%29)) Over the years, Dark Tranquillity has released several influential albums, including "The Gallery" (1995), "The Mind's I" (1997), and "Haven" (2000). Their 2024 release, "Endtime Signals," continues to demonstrate their evolution while maintaining the core elements that fans appreciate. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/albums/Dark_Tranquillity/Endtime_Signals/1250419)) The band's music is characterized by melodic death metal elements, incorporating atmospheric keyboards and varied vocal styles. Their lyrics often explore themes of death, memories, despair, and chaos theory. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/bands/Dark_Tranquillity/8)) As of October 2025, the current lineup includes Mikael Stanne (vocals), Johan Reinholdz (guitar), Martin Brändström (keyboards), Christian Jansson (bass), and Joakim Strandberg Nilsson (drums). ([darktranquillity.com](https://www.darktranquillity.com/))

bands.name: Winterfylleth
bands.description:
Winterfylleth is an English black metal band from Manchester, formed in 2006. The band's name, derived from Old English, translates to "Winter Full Moon," symbolizing the first full moon of winter. Their music is characterized by atmospheric black metal infused with folk elements, reflecting themes of ancient British history, Anglo-Saxon literature, nature, and landscapes.

Since their inception, Winterfylleth has released several studio albums:

- **The Ghost of Heritage** (2008): Their debut album, released through Profound Lore Records, received critical acclaim for its atmospheric depth and thematic focus.

- **The Mercian Sphere** (2010): Released via Candlelight Records, this album continued their exploration of English heritage, featuring a trilogy inspired by the Old English poem "The Wanderer." ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Mercian_Sphere))

- **The Threnody of Triumph** (2012): This album further solidified their reputation in the black metal scene, showcasing their evolving sound and thematic depth. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Threnody_of_Triumph))

- **The Divination of Antiquity** (2014): Released on 6 October 2014, this album delves into themes of history and cyclical time, encouraging listeners to learn from the past. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Divination_of_Antiquity))

- **The Dark Hereafter** (2016): This album features five tracks, including a cover of Ulver's "I troldskog faren vild," and continues their tradition of atmospheric black metal. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Dark_Hereafter))

- **The Hallowing of Heirdom** (2018): Released on 6 April 2018, this album continues their exploration of English heritage themes. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/albums/Winterfylleth/The_Hallowing_of_Heirdom/730867))

- **The Reckoning Dawn** (2020): Released on 8 May 2020, this album received critical acclaim, with Metal Hammer naming it the 28th best metal album of 2020.

- **The Imperious Horizon** (2024): Released on 13 September 2024, this album continues their tradition of atmospheric black metal. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/albums/Winterfylleth/The_Imperious_Horizon/1247380))

Winterfylleth's music is noted for its atmospheric depth, melodic complexity, and thematic focus on English heritage, distinguishing them within the black metal genre.

bands.name: Parasite Inc.
bands.description: Parasite Inc. is a German melodic death metal band formed in 2007 in Aalen. The lineup consists of Kai Bigler (vocals, guitar), Dominik Sorg (guitar), Lucien Mosesku (bass), and Benjamin Stelzer (drums). ([parasiteinc.de](https://www.parasiteinc.de/band/)) The band debuted with a self-titled demo in 2010, recorded in their own studio. Their first full-length album, "Time Tears Down," was released in 2013, followed by "Dead and Alive" in 2018, which reached number 33 on the German charts. In 2022, they released "Cyan Night Dreams," which peaked at number 20 on the German charts. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parasite_Inc.)) Their music blends death metal with harmonic riffs and electronic elements, and they have been praised for their live performances across Europe. ([parasiteinc.de](https://www.parasiteinc.de/band/))

bands.name: Deceased
bands.description: Deceased is an American death/thrash metal band formed in Arlington, Virginia, in 1985. Initially known as Mad Butcher, they changed their name to Deceased in 1986. The original lineup consisted of vocalist and drummer King Fowley, guitarist Doug Souther, guitarist Mark Adams, and bassist Rob Sterzel. Tragedy struck in 1988 when Sterzel and several friends were killed in a hit-and-run accident. Les Snyder replaced him as bassist later that year. In 1990, Deceased became the first band to sign with Relapse Records, releasing four albums and several EPs before parting ways with the label in 2003. Their music is characterized by themes of horror, with lyrics often barked and sometimes narrated by Fowley. Over the years, the band has released several studio albums, including "Luck of the Corpse" (1991), "The Blueprints for Madness" (1995), "Fearless Undead Machines" (1997), "Supernatural Addiction" (2000), "As the Weird Travel On" (2005), "Surreal Overdose" (2011), "Ghostly White" (2018), and "Children of the Morgue" (2024). Their style blends death metal and thrash metal, with lyrics centered around horror themes. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deceased_%28band%29))

bands.name: Sanguisugabogg
bands.description:
Sanguisugabogg is an American death metal band formed in 2019 in Columbus, Ohio. The band was established by guitarist Cameron Boggs, and their name is a combination of "sanguisuga" (Latin for "leech") and "bog" (British slang for "toilet"). The current lineup includes drummer Cody Davidson, vocalist Devin Swank, guitarist-bassist Cedrik Davis, and guitarist-bassist Drew Arnold.

Their debut EP, "Pornographic Seizures," was released in 2019 through Maggot Stomp. In 2021, they released their first full-length album, "Tortured Whole," via Century Media Records, which was noted for its raw and primitive approach, blending brutal death metal with a "swampy Obituary kick." ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sanguisugabogg))

In 2023, Sanguisugabogg released "Homicidal Ecstasy," refining their sound with slightly more technicality while retaining their signature primal and sludgy aesthetic. The album was co-released with Fix My Face Records and featured exclusive artwork by Caleb Butcher. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/albums/Sanguisugabogg/Homicidal_Ecstasy/1245881))

Their third studio album, "Hideous Aftermath," was released on October 10, 2025, via Century Media Records. Produced by Kurt Ballou at God City Studio, the album features guest appearances by Dylan Walker of Full of Hell, Travis Ryan of Cattle Decapitation, Damonteal Harris of PeelingFlesh, Josh Welshman of Defeated Sanity, and Todd Jones. The lead single, "Abhorrent Contraception," was released on June 27, 2025. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hideous_Aftermath))

Sanguisugabogg's music is characterized by heavy, down-tuned riffs and guttural vocals, drawing influences from classic death metal bands while incorporating a modern, sludgy sound. Their lyrics often explore themes of violence and horror, consistent with the death metal genre.

The band has faced challenges, including the suspension of their Instagram account in November 2024 without clear explanation. They expressed frustration over the lack of communication from the platform and the impact on their ability to engage with fans. ([theprp.com](https://www.theprp.com/2024/11/15/news/sanguisugabogg-protest-the-suspension-of-their-instagram-account-we-got-zucked/))

Sanguisugabogg continues to tour and release new music, contributing to the evolution of the death metal scene.

bands.name: The Gathering
bands.description: The Gathering is a Dutch rock band formed in 1989 in Oss, Netherlands. Initially, they played atmospheric doom metal influenced by bands like Celtic Frost and Hellhammer. Their 1995 album "Mandylion," featuring vocalist Anneke van Giersbergen, marked a significant shift towards a more atmospheric and experimental sound, blending elements of shoegaze, post-rock, and trip-hop. This evolution continued with albums like "How to Measure a Planet?" in 1998 and "If Then Else" in 2000. After van Giersbergen's departure in 2007, Silje Wergeland joined as the lead vocalist. The band went on hiatus from 2014 to 2018 and released their eleventh studio album, "Beautiful Distortion," in April 2022. In December 2024, they announced reunion shows with the "Mandylion" lineup, including van Giersbergen, to celebrate the album's 30th anniversary. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Gathering_%28band%29))

bands.name: Powerwolf
bands.description: Powerwolf is a German power metal band formed in 2004 in Saarbrücken, Saarland. Known for their theatrical stage presence and unique blend of heavy metal, they incorporate religious themes, gothic elements, and legends of werewolves and vampires into their music. The band released their debut album, "Return in Bloodred," in 2005, followed by "Lupus Dei" in 2007, which gained them significant recognition. Their 2009 album, "Bible of the Beast," further solidified their reputation in the power metal scene. In 2018, they released "The Sacrament of Sin," showcasing their evolving sound. Their latest album, "Wake Up the Wicked," was released in 2024, marking a new chapter in their career. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Powerwolf))

bands.name: Hateful Agony
bands.description: Hateful Agony is a German thrash metal band formed in Munich in 1997. The band has undergone several lineup changes over the years, with drummer Tom Hörbe being the only constant member since its inception. Their music is characterized by aggressive riffs and energetic performances, drawing influences from classic thrash metal bands like Destruction, Forbidden, Testament, Slayer, and Kreator. They have released several albums, including 'Plastic Culture Pestilence' in 2018 and 'Home Sweet Hell' in 2023. In May 2023, they signed with Punishment 18 Records, indicating a continued presence in the thrash metal scene.

bands.name: Fallujah
bands.description:
Fallujah is an American technical death metal band formed in San Francisco, California, in 2007. Initially, their music was heavily influenced by the Bay Area hardcore scene, often sharing stages with bands like Lionheart and Suffokate. Over time, they evolved into a progressive and technical death metal outfit, known for their intricate compositions and atmospheric soundscapes. Their discography includes:

- "The Harvest Wombs" (2011)
- "The Flesh Prevails" (2014)
- "Dreamless" (2016)
- "Undying Light" (2019)
- "Empyrean" (2022)
- "Xenotaph" (2025)

"Xenotaph," released on June 13, 2025, is their sixth studio album. Vocalist Kyle Schaefer described it as the band's "most technical, dynamic and progressive material to date," featuring tracks like "Kaleidoscopic Waves," "Labyrinth of Stone," and "Step Through the Portal and Breathe." ([metalplanetmusic.com](https://metalplanetmusic.com/2025/05/fallujah-reveal-third-single-from-forthcoming-lp/))

The current lineup consists of:

- Scott Carstairs – lead guitar, backing vocals (2007–present)
- Kyle Schaefer – vocals (2022–present)
- Evan Brewer – bass (2022–present)
- Sam Mooradian – rhythm guitar (2023–present)
- Kevin Alexander – drums (2023–present)

Their music blends technical death metal with progressive elements, creating a unique and evolving sound.

bands.name: Ice Nine Kills
bands.description: Ice Nine Kills is an American heavy metal band from Boston, Massachusetts, known for their horror-inspired lyrics and theatrical performances. Formed in 2000 by high school friends Spencer Charnas and Jeremy Schwartz, the band initially went by the name Ice Nine before adopting their current moniker in 2006. They released their debut album, "Last Chance to Make Amends," in 2006, followed by "The Burning" EP in 2007. Their 2014 album, "The Predator Becomes the Prey," marked their first entry on the Billboard 200 chart. In 2018, they released "The Silver Scream," an album inspired by various horror films, which debuted at number 27 on the Billboard 200. The band's 2021 album, "Welcome to Horrorwood: The Silver Scream 2," continued this theme, featuring songs inspired by films like "Child's Play" and "Resident Evil." Their music blends metalcore with elements of symphonic metal and post-hardcore, creating a distinctive sound that has garnered a dedicated fanbase. As of October 2025, the band is set to release "The Laugh Track," inspired by "The Silence of the Lambs," and is collaborating with actor Matthew Lillard on a new bourbon called "Horrorwood Reserve." ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ice_Nine_Kills))

bands.name: Malevolence
bands.description: Malevolence is a British metalcore band formed in Sheffield, South Yorkshire, in 2010. The band was established by guitarists Josh Baines and Konan Hall, who began performing together at the age of twelve. They were later joined by vocalist Alex Taylor, solidifying the lineup. In 2013, Malevolence released their debut album, "Reign of Suffering," through Siege of Amida Records. This was followed by "Self Supremacy" in 2017, which showcased a more complex songwriting style and incorporated elements of thrash metal. In 2022, they released "Malicious Intent," further solidifying their presence in the metalcore scene. In June 2025, they released "Where Only the Truth Is Spoken," produced by Josh Wilbur. The band has toured extensively, sharing stages with acts like Obey the Brave, Kublai Khan, and Dying Fetus. Known for their energetic live performances and DIY ethos, Malevolence established their own record label, MLVLTD Music, to maintain creative control over their releases. Their music is characterized by a fusion of groove metal, hardcore, and sludge, drawing influences from bands like Pantera, Hatebreed, Lamb of God, and Biohazard. Lyrically, they explore themes of rage, loss, revenge, and resilience.

bands.name: Europe
bands.description: Europe is a Swedish rock band formed in Upplands Väsby in 1979. The original lineup consisted of lead vocalist Joey Tempest, guitarist John Norum, bassist Peter Olsson, and drummer Tony Reno. They gained significant attention in Sweden after winning the inaugural Rock-SM (Swedish Rock Championships) in 1982. Their international breakthrough came with the release of their third album, "The Final Countdown," in 1986, which featured the iconic title track that topped charts worldwide. The band's style has evolved over the years, incorporating elements of arena rock, hard rock, glam metal, blues rock, and heavy metal. After a brief hiatus in the early 1990s, Europe reunited in 1999 and has since released several albums, including "Start from the Dark" (2004), "Secret Society" (2006), "Last Look at Eden" (2009), "Bag of Bones" (2012), "War of Kings" (2015), "Walk the Earth" (2017), and "Secret Society" (2020). The band's current lineup includes Joey Tempest (vocals), John Norum (guitar), John Levén (bass), Mic Michaeli (keyboards), and Ian Haugland (drums).

bands.name: Voice Of Baceprot
bands.description:
Voice of Baceprot (VoB) is an Indonesian all-female metal trio formed in 2014 in Garut, West Java. The band comprises Firda "Marsya" Kurnia (vocals and guitar), Widi Rahmawati (bass), and Euis Siti Aisyah (drums). They are known for their energetic performances and for challenging stereotypes about Muslim women in metal music. The name "Baceprot" means "noisy" in Sundanese, reflecting their musical style. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Voice_of_Baceprot))

VoB gained international attention with their 2015 cover of Rage Against the Machine's "Guerrilla Radio," which went viral on YouTube. Their debut single, "School Revolution," was released in 2018, followed by their first full-length album, "Retas," in 2023. In 2024, they became the first Indonesian act to perform at the Glastonbury Festival. ([reuters.com](https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/indonesian-muslim-metal-group-braces-biggest-stage-yet-2024-06-23/))

Their music blends elements of nu metal, funk metal, thrash metal, progressive metal, and rap metal. In May 2025, they released their latest EP, "Transisi," featuring six tracks that explore themes of transformation and resistance to stagnation. ([voiceofbaceprot.com](https://voiceofbaceprot.com/web/posts/press-release-a-bold-new-chapter-voice-of-baceprot-unleashes-explosive-mini-album-transisi-1747917776))

For more information, visit their official website at [voiceofbaceprot.com](https://voiceofbaceprot.com/).

bands.name: End It
bands.description: End It is a Baltimore-based hardcore punk band known for their aggressive style and high-energy live performances. Formed in 2019, the band quickly gained recognition in the hardcore scene with their 2022 EP, "Unpleasant Living," released under Flatspot Records. This EP showcases their blend of thrash metal-inspired riffs and old-school hardcore beatdowns, delivering a raw and intense listening experience. The band embarked on "The Wrong Side of Heaven Tour" in 2025, highlighting their growing prominence in the hardcore community. Their music is characterized by confrontational lyrics and a relentless pace, reflecting the band's commitment to the hardcore ethos.

bands.name: Northlane
bands.description: Northlane is an Australian metalcore band formed in 2009 in Blacktown, New South Wales. The lineup consists of lead guitarist Jon Deiley, rhythm guitarist Josh Smith, drummer Nic Pettersen, and vocalist Marcus Bridge. They have released six studio albums: 'Discoveries' (2011), 'Singularity' (2013), 'Node' (2015), 'Mesmer' (2017), 'Alien' (2019), and 'Obsidian' (2022). Their music blends metalcore with progressive metal, djent, and alternative metal elements, characterized by atmospheric textures and introspective lyrics. In 2015, 'Node' topped the ARIA Albums Chart, and the band won the ARIA Award for Best Hard Rock or Heavy Metal Album in 2015, 2017, and 2019. In 2021, Northlane became fully independent, self-producing their records and launching a Patreon community to engage with fans. ([lambgoat.com](https://lambgoat.com/news/34873/northlane-go-fully-independent-launch-patreon/))

bands.name: Gothminister
bands.description: Gothminister is a Norwegian gothic metal band formed in 1999 by lead vocalist and producer Bjørn Alexander Brem. The band is renowned for blending gothic and industrial metal elements, incorporating electronic music alongside metal guitars and dark lyrical themes. Their debut album, "Gothic Electronic Anthems," released in 2003, received critical acclaim and established their presence in the European metal scene. The follow-up, "Empire of Dark Salvation," released in 2005, showcased a darker and heavier sound, with the track "Monsters" reaching number 11 on the German Alternative Charts. In 2008, they released "Happiness in Darkness," which continued their exploration of gothic and industrial metal, featuring guest vocals by Nell Sigland on several tracks. The band has been active in the German music festival circuit, performing at events like Wave-Gotik-Treffen, Dark Storm Festival, and M'era Luna Festival, often playing in front of large audiences. In 2024, they participated in the Norwegian selection for the Eurovision Song Contest with the song "We Come Alive," advancing to the final and finishing fourth. Their latest album, "Pandemonium II: The Battle of the Underworlds," was released on May 3, 2024, continuing their tradition of combining heavy metal with electronic elements to create a unique and atmospheric sound.

bands.name: Amon Amarth
bands.description:
Amon Amarth is a Swedish melodic death metal band formed in 1992 in Tumba, Stockholm. The band's name is derived from the Sindarin term for Mount Doom in J.R.R. Tolkien's Middle-earth. Their music is characterized by themes of Viking mythology, warfare, and destruction, often referred to as "Viking metal." The current lineup includes lead guitarist Olavi Mikkonen, vocalist Johan Hegg, bassist Ted Lundström, rhythm guitarist Johan Söderberg, and drummer Jocke Wallgren. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amon_Amarth))

Amon Amarth's discography showcases their evolution and impact on the metal scene. Their debut album, "Once Sent from the Golden Hall" (1998), established their signature sound. This was followed by "The Avenger" (1999), "The Crusher" (2001), and "Versus the World" (2002), each album refining their style and expanding their reach. "Versus the World" marked a shift to a heavier, mid-paced sound, distinguishing it from their earlier, faster works. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Versus_the_World_%28Amon_Amarth_album%29))

In 2025, Amon Amarth embarked on "The Great Heathen Tour," performing across North America, including a historic headlining show at the Kia Forum in Los Angeles. ([amonamarthtour.com](https://www.amonamarthtour.com/))

Their official website, [amonamarth.com](https://www.amonamarth.com/), offers the latest news, tour dates, and merchandise.

bands.name: The Rasmus
bands.description:
The Rasmus is a Finnish rock band formed in Helsinki in 1994. The original lineup consisted of Lauri Ylönen (vocals, songwriter), Eero Heinonen (bass), Pauli Rantasalmi (guitar), and Jarno Lahti (drums). After Lahti's departure in 1995, Janne Heiskanen joined as the new drummer, followed by Aki Hakala in 1999. In 2022, Rantasalmi left the band and was replaced by Emilia "Emppu" Suhonen. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Rasmus))

The band's early work, including their debut album "Peep" (1996), showcased a pop-rock style. However, with the release of "Hell of a Tester" in 1998, they transitioned to a more solid rock sound, earning gold status in Finland.
