Initially a cover band, they transitioned to writing original music, self-producing their first single in 2016. After a period as an independent band, during which they released an album and an EP, they signed with Epic Records Japan, a subsidiary of Sony Music Japan, in 2023. In January 2023, they released the single "Pardon Me, I Have to Go Now," which garnered international attention and led to performances at festivals such as MetalDays, Leyendas del Rock, and Aftershock. In July 2023, they released their second album, "Reborn Superstar!" which peaked at number 26 on Billboard Japan's weekly album charts. The album's release coincided with their 8th anniversary national Japan tour. Shortly thereafter, the band embarked on their first European tour in August, followed by their first US tour in September. They opened for Limp Bizkit in November and accompanied the British metalcore band While She Sleeps on their Asia tour as an opening act. In January 2024, they released the single "Otaku Lovely Densetsu" and began the "Hajimete no Lovely Legend 2-man Japan Tour." In June 2024, they announced their North American tour as an opening act for Jinjer, along with Born of Osiris. In December 2024, they released the six-song EP "Bucchigiri Tokyo," which peaked at number 3 on Oricon's weekly rock album chart. The EP includes the track "Ito Okashi My Type," which ranked number 1 on The Kerrang Chart. In May 2025, they released the single "Spicy Queen."

bands.name: Orden Ogan
bands.description: Orden Ogan is a German power metal band formed in 1996 in Arnsberg, North Rhine-Westphalia. Initially named Tanzende Aingewaide, they changed their name to Orden Ogan in 1997, meaning "The Order of Fear," combining the German word "Orden" (order) with the Old Celtic word "Ogan" (fear). The band released three demo tapes: "Into Oblivion" (1998), "Soli Deo Gloria" (1999), and "Testimonium A.D." (2004), which helped them gain recognition in the German metal scene. Their debut studio album, "Vale," was released in 2008, followed by "Easton Hope" in 2010, "To The End" in 2012, "Ravenhead" in 2015, "Gunmen" in 2017, "Final Days" in 2021, and "The Order of Fear" in 2024. The band's music blends power metal with elements of folk and progressive metal, often featuring the narrative of their mascot, Alister Vale, an immortal cursed to witness the decay of everything he leaves behind. Orden Ogan has been known for their energetic live performances and has organized the German metal festival WinterNachtsTraum, featuring bands like Rage, Sinister, Axxis, Ensiferum, Van Canto, and Agathodaimon.

bands.name: Stahlmann
bands.description: Stahlmann is a German Neue Deutsche Härte band formed in Göttingen in 2008. The band was founded by vocalist Martin Soer and guitarist Alexander Scharfe, who were later joined by guitarist Tobias "Tobi" Berkefeld. They are known for their energetic performances, often featuring members painted in silver and wearing black attire. Their music blends industrial metal with electronic elements, drawing comparisons to bands like Rammstein. In 2009, they released their debut EP "Herzschlag," which entered the top 20 of the Deutsche Alternative Charts for four weeks. This success led to tours with bands such as Doro, In Extremo, and Saltatio Mortis. Their self-titled debut album was released in September 2010, followed by "Quecksilber" in January 2012, which peaked at number 39 on the German album charts. Subsequent albums include "Adamant" (2013), "CO2" (2015), "Bastard" (2017), "Kinder der Sehnsucht" (2019), and "Quarz" (2021). In October 2025, they released the EP "Addendum," featuring the single "1000 Gründe," which delves into themes of past love and mortality. ([side-line.com](https://www.side-line.com/german-neue-deutsche-harte-band-stahlmann-returns-with-new-ep-addendum/?utm_source=openai)) Their music is characterized by a mix of new wave, alternative metal, groove metal, electro-industrial, and techno, all set to German lyrics. ([music.apple.com](https://music.apple.com/us/artist/stahlmann/334713823?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Uburen
bands.description: Formed in 2010 in Stavanger, Norway, Uburen is a black and viking metal band known for their intense live performances and atmospheric soundscapes. The band's name, derived from Old Norse, translates to "carried out" or "cast out," referencing a mountain with a dark history in the birthplace of members Ask and Bior. Their music blends harsh black metal with personal interpretations of viking metal, creating a unique and haunting experience. Over the years, Uburen has headlined tours across Mexico, England, Germany, and Russia, sharing stages with prominent acts like Enslaved, Einherjer, Dimmu Borgir, Carpathian Forest, and Harakiri For the Sky. In January 2023, they released "Usurp the Throne," an eight-track album that delves into themes of Norse mythology and the struggle against false prophecies, marking a significant milestone in their discography. ([uburen.com](https://www.uburen.com/bio?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Mawiza
bands.description: Mawiza is a Chilean metal band that seamlessly blends traditional Mapuche culture with modern groove metal, delivering a unique and powerful musical experience. Formed in 2014 under the name Nunca Seremos Dichosos, the band initially incorporated elements of indigenous folklore and Latin American music into their metal sound. Their debut album, "Tierra," released in 2017, featured nine tracks that resonated with themes of identity and social issues, particularly aimed at the Latin American audience. In 2019, they released "Kollong," which included "Mawiza Ñi Piwke," the first metal song sung entirely in Mapudungun, the language of the Mapuche people. This album earned them the prestigious Pulsar Award for Best Metal Artist in 2020. After several lineup changes, the band rebranded as Mawiza in 2021, fully embracing Mapudungun in their music. Their third album, "Ül," released on July 18, 2025, marks their first collaboration with Season of Mist. The album integrates tribal rhythms and ancient instruments into modern groove metal, paying homage to the Mapuche nation's ancestral spirit. Tracks like "Wingkawnoam" and "Mamüll Reke" exemplify this fusion, with "Mamüll Reke" receiving the Silver award in Metal/Hardcore Songwriting at the LIT Music Awards in October 2025. Mawiza's music serves as a cultural bridge, honoring their roots while appealing to a global audience. They have shared stages with renowned bands such as Gojira, Mastodon, Mercyful Fate, Slipknot, and Gojira, and have performed at major festivals, including Rock Al Parque 2025 in Colombia. Their commitment to preserving and promoting Mapuche culture through music continues to inspire and resonate with listeners worldwide.

bands.name: Eivør
bands.description: Eivør Pálsdóttir, known mononymously as Eivør, is a Faroese singer-songwriter born on July 21, 1983, in Syðrugøta, Faroe Islands. She began her musical journey at the age of 13 with her first televised performance and won a national contest in 1996. In 1999, she joined the rock band Clickhaze as the lead vocalist. The following year, she released her self-titled debut album, "Eivør Pálsdóttir," which blends traditional Faroese songs with jazz influences. In 2002, she moved to Reykjavík to study music and released an album with the jazz group Yggdrasil. Her second solo album, "Krákan," released in 2003, earned her three nominations at the Icelandic Music Awards, where she won Best Singer and Best Performer. Over the years, Eivør's music has spanned various genres, including folk, art pop, jazz, and electronica. She has received multiple accolades, including the Nordic Council Music Prize in 2021. Her unique blend of dark electronica and Faroese folk has garnered her a dedicated following, with her music amassing close to a billion streams. Eivør has also contributed to soundtracks for "God of War Ragnarök" and the Netflix series "The Last Kingdom." In September 2023, she signed with Season of Mist, and in July 2025, she announced a deal with Nuclear Blast Records. Her latest album, "ENN," was released in 2024.

bands.name: Urne
bands.description: Urne is a London-based modern metal band formed in 2016, known for their unique blend of stoner, sludge metal, and metalcore influences. The band comprises bassist and vocalist Joe Nally, guitarist Angus Neyra, and drummer James Cook. Their music is characterized by a fusion of heavy riffs, dynamic rhythms, and emotive vocals, creating a sound that is both aggressive and atmospheric. In 2021, Urne released their debut full-length album, "Serpent & Spirit," which received positive reviews for its compelling songwriting and production. The album was released on vinyl through Candlelight Records. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/albums/Urne/Serpent_%26_Spirit/957976?utm_source=openai)) In 2023, they followed up with "A Feast on Sorrow," further solidifying their presence in the metal scene. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/albums/Urne/A_Feast_on_Sorrow/1137426?utm_source=openai)) Looking ahead, Urne announced their third studio album, "Setting Fire to the Sky," scheduled for release on January 30, 2026, via Spinefarm Records. The announcement was accompanied by the single "Be Not Dismayed," which encourages fans to embrace the metal community without intimidation. ([spinefarmrecords.com](https://www.spinefarmrecords.com/590/news/src/?utm_source=openai)) Urne's music continues to resonate with fans, showcasing their evolution and commitment to delivering powerful metal.

bands.name: Forbidden
bands.description: Forbidden is an American thrash metal band from the San Francisco Bay Area, California. Formed in 1985 as Forbidden Evil, they shortened their name to Forbidden in 1987. The original lineup included vocalist Russ Anderson, guitarists Craig Locicero and Robb Flynn, bassist John Tegio, and drummer Jim Pittman. They quickly gained prominence in the Bay Area thrash scene, known for their technical prowess and aggressive compositions. In 1988, they released their debut album, "Forbidden Evil," which received critical acclaim and is considered a classic in the thrash metal genre. The follow-up, "Twisted into Form," released in 1990, showcased a more melodic and progressive approach, featuring acoustic interludes and clearer production. This album marked the last appearance of drummer Paul Bostaph before he joined Slayer in 1992. After a series of lineup changes and a brief hiatus, Forbidden reunited in 2007, releasing "Omega Wave" in 2010. The band experienced another hiatus in 2012 but reformed in 2023 with a new lineup, including vocalist Norman Skinner, guitarist Craig Locicero, bassist Matt Camacho, and drummer Chris Kontos. They began writing new material, with plans for a studio album in early 2025. In June 2025, they released "Divided by Zero," their first song in 15 years, to streaming services. Forbidden is recognized as one of the "Big Six" of the Bay Area thrash metal scene, alongside Exodus, Testament, Death Angel, Lȧȧz Rockit, and Vio-lence.

bands.name: Gehenna
bands.description: Gehenna is a Norwegian black metal band formed in January 1993 in Stavanger. The original lineup consisted of Sanrabb (guitar, vocals), Dolgar (guitar), and Sir Vereda (bass). After Vereda's departure due to legal issues, Dirge Rep joined as the drummer, and Svartalv became the bassist. The band released their first demo, "Black Seared Heart," in 1993, followed by their debut full-length album, "Seen Through the Veils of Darkness (The Second Spell)," in 1995. Their second album, "Malice (Our Third Spell)," released in 1996, is noted for its symphonic black metal style. In 2000, they released "Murder," which marked a shift towards a more death metal-oriented sound. The band has undergone several lineup changes over the years, with Sanrabb remaining the constant member. Gehenna has been associated with labels such as Necromantic Gallery Productions, Head Not Found, Cacophonous, Moonfog Productions, ANP, and Indie Recordings. They have also been associated with acts like Dismal Euphony. Gehenna's music is characterized by a blend of black metal, symphonic elements, and death metal influences, creating a dark and atmospheric sound.

bands.name: Kylesa
bands.description: Kylesa is an American heavy metal band formed in Savannah, Georgia, in 2001. The group emerged from the remnants of the sludge metal band Damad, with guitarist and vocalist Phillip Cope and bassist Brian Duke being former members. They were joined by guitarist and vocalist Laura Pleasants, who was attending the Savannah College of Art and Design at the time. The band's music is characterized by a fusion of sludge metal, stoner rock, doom metal, and psychedelic rock, creating a distinctive and experimental sound. Kylesa's lineup has evolved over the years, with notable additions such as drummers Carl McGinley and Jeff Porter in 2006, and Eric Hernandez in 2008. The dual-drummer setup contributed to their unique percussive and atmospheric style. Throughout their career, Kylesa released several albums, including their self-titled debut in 2002, "To Walk a Middle Course" in 2005, "Time Will Fuse Its Worth" in 2006, "Static Tensions" in 2009, "Spiral Shadow" in 2010, "Ultraviolet" in 2013, and "Exhausting Fire" in 2015. In April 2016, the band announced an indefinite hiatus. However, in August 2024, Kylesa announced their return to the stage, with plans to perform at the 2025 Roadburn Festival in Tilburg, Netherlands, marking their first live performance in nearly a decade. The reunion is set to celebrate the band's 25th anniversary, with additional special shows planned throughout 2025.

bands.name: Mushroomhead
bands.description: Mushroomhead is an American heavy metal band from Cleveland, Ohio, formed in 1993. Known for their theatrical live shows and distinctive masks, the band blends elements of alternative metal, industrial metal, and experimental metal. Their self-titled debut album was released independently in 1995, followed by "Superbuick" in 1996 and "M3" in 1999. In 2001, they signed with Eclipse Records, releasing "XX," a compilation of their earlier work. Their 2003 album "XIII" sold over 200,000 units in the USA alone. In 2006, they released "Savior Sorrow," and in 2010, "Beautiful Stories for Ugly Children." Their 2014 album "The Righteous & the Butterfly" debuted at #44 on the Billboard charts. In 2020, they released "A Wonderful Life," introducing vocalist Jackie LaPonza. Their latest album, "Call the Devil," was released on August 9, 2024, featuring new members and marking a return to their heavy, experimental roots. ([mushroomhead.com](https://mushroomhead.com/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Do Or Die
bands.description: Formed in 1999 in Tournai, Belgium, Do Or Die is a thrash metal band known for their energetic performances and aggressive sound. The band quickly gained recognition with their debut EP, "Tears of Rage," released in 2000, which sold 500 copies in less than a month. Their first full-length album, "Heart Full of Pain," followed in 2001, showcasing their commitment to the hardcore and metal scenes. In 2002, they released "The Meaning of Honor," further solidifying their presence in the European metal community. Despite lineup changes over the years, including departures in 2003, Do Or Die has maintained a strong presence, performing at major European festivals and sharing stages with bands like Hatebreed, Agnostic Front, Pro-Pain, and Biohazard. In 2011, they signed with Demons Run Amok Entertainment, releasing "The Downfall of the Human Race," and in 2015, they released "Crows" under M&O Music. In 2019, the band rebranded as Bury Your Demons, continuing to honor their legacy while exploring new musical directions.

bands.name: Panopticon
bands.description: Panopticon is an American black metal band founded by Austin Lunn in Louisville, Kentucky, in 2007. Initially a solo project, Lunn wrote all songs and played all instruments on the self-titled debut album released in 2008. The band's music uniquely blends black metal with elements of bluegrass and Appalachian folk, incorporating instruments such as banjo, fiddle, and acoustic guitar. Lunn's lyrics often address themes like environmentalism, anarchism, and social issues, reflecting his personal and political views. The 2012 album "Kentucky" is a notable example, combining black metal with traditional Appalachian music to comment on the state's coal industry. The 2015 album "Autumn Eternal" continued this fusion, incorporating regional folk influences. In 2018, "The Scars of Man on the Once Nameless Wilderness" further explored the integration of country and folk elements with black metal. The 2021 album "...And Again into the Light" showcased Lunn's diverse songwriting, featuring personal and family-oriented lyrics. In 2025, Panopticon released "Songs of Hiraeth," a black metal album, and "Laurentian Blue," a folk album, demonstrating the band's versatility and commitment to blending genres.

bands.name: Infected Rain
bands.description: Infected Rain is a Moldovan heavy metal band formed in 2008 in Chișinău. The group was established by guitarist Vadim "Vidick" Ojog, lead vocalist Elena "Lena Scissorhands" Cataraga, and DJ Ivan "DJ Kapa" Kristioglo. They debuted in August 2008 at a concert dedicated to Slayer and later participated in the Red Alert festival in Crimea. Their first demo CD, released in August 2008, featured three songs: "With Me," "Parasite," and "No Idols." In 2009, they released the "EP2009," composed of six songs, and embarked on a two-month tour across 12 European countries to support their new album. Their music is characterized by a blend of nu metal, metalcore, groove metal, melodic death metal, and alternative metal, with lyrics written in English by Lena Scissorhands. The band's discography includes six studio albums: "Asylum" (2011), "Embrace Eternity" (2014), "86" (2017), "Endorphin" (2019), "Ecdysis" (2022), and "TIME" (2024). The current lineup consists of Lena Scissorhands (vocals), Vadim "Vidick" Ojog (guitar), Eugene Voluta (drums), and Alice Lane (bass). ([infectedrain.com](https://www.infectedrain.com/about-us/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Rivers Of Nihil
bands.description:
Rivers Of Nihil is an American technical death metal band from Reading, Pennsylvania, formed in 2009. The band is known for their intricate compositions and thematic explorations of the natural world, cosmos, and human nature. They have released five studio albums:

- "The Conscious Seed of Light" (2013)
- "Monarchy" (2015)
- "Where Owls Know My Name" (2018)
- "The Work" (2021)
- "Rivers of Nihil" (2025)

Their 2018 album, "Where Owls Know My Name," debuted at number 61 on the Billboard 200, marking a significant milestone in their career. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Where_Owls_Know_My_Name?utm_source=openai)) The band's lineup has evolved over the years, with founding members Adam Biggs (vocals, bass) and Brody Uttley (guitars) remaining constants. In 2023, Andy Thomas joined as guitarist and vocalist, and Jared Klein took over on drums. ([riversofnihil.com](https://riversofnihil.com/?utm_source=openai)) Their music is characterized by a blend of technical proficiency and progressive elements, appealing to fans of complex and thought-provoking metal.

bands.name: Suicidal Tendencies
bands.description: Suicidal Tendencies is an American crossover thrash band formed in 1980 in Venice, California, by vocalist Mike Muir. The band is known for blending elements of thrash metal and hardcore punk, creating a distinctive sound that has influenced numerous artists. Over the years, Suicidal Tendencies has undergone various lineup changes, with Muir remaining the sole original member. The current lineup includes Muir, guitarists Dean Pleasants and Ben Weinman, bassist Tye Trujillo, and drummer Jay Weinberg. The band's discography includes notable albums such as "Join the Army" (1987), which marked a shift towards a more metal-oriented sound, and "The Art of Rebellion" (1992), their most commercially successful album. In 2016, they released "World Gone Mad," featuring drummer Dave Lombardo. In 2025, they returned with the single "Adrenaline Addict," showcasing their enduring energy and relevance in the metal scene.

bands.name: Angus McSix
bands.description: Angus McSix is an international power metal band formed in August 2021 by Swiss singer Thomas Winkler and German producer, vocalist, and guitarist Sebastian "Seeb" Levermann. The formation of the band followed Winkler's departure from Gloryhammer, with Levermann reaching out to collaborate on a new power metal supergroup. The name "Angus McSix" is a continuation of Winkler's previous stage character, Angus McFife, symbolizing an upgraded and more powerful version of the character. To complete the lineup, the duo enlisted Italian guitarist Thalia Bellazecca and former Rhapsody of Fire drummer Manu Lotter. The band's debut studio album, "Angus McSix and the Sword of Power," was released on April 21, 2023, through Napalm Records. The album continues the narrative of the fictional Scottish crown prince Angus McFife XIII, who returns from the realm of the dead as a stronger version of himself, now known as Angus McSix. The album achieved significant success, reaching number ten on the German album charts, number 16 in Switzerland, and number 26 in Austria, marking it as one of the most successful debuts for a power metal band in those countries. In January 2025, Winkler announced his departure from the band to focus on family, with Sam Nyman stepping in as the new vocalist portraying Prince Adam McSix. Additionally, Lotter departed, and Gerit Lamm joined as the new drummer. The band released a new single, "6666," in January 2025, and another single, "The Fire of Yore," in September 2025, featuring actor and musician Uwe Ochsenknecht in the official video. The band's music is characterized by a blend of late 1990s power metal and modern disco elements, drawing comparisons to bands like Sonata Arctica and Blind Guardian. The vocals are powerful and clear, often compared to Rob Halford or Ronnie James Dio, with song structures primarily in classic verse form.

bands.name: Blackbraid
bands.description: Blackbraid is an American black metal project from the Adirondack Mountains, New York, formed in 2022. The project is the solo endeavor of its creator, Jon Krieger, a native Mexican also known by his Mohawk name, Sgah’gahsowáh, meaning "the witch hawk." Blackbraid is part of the growing indigenous black metal scene in the United States, blending traditional black metal with elements of indigenous music. The debut album, "Blackbraid I," was released on August 26, 2022, featuring tracks like "Barefoot Ghost Dance on Blood Soaked Soil," which alludes to historical events such as the Wounded Knee massacre and the Dakota Access Pipeline protests. The second album, "Blackbraid II," was released on July 7, 2023, and received critical acclaim for its expansion of the sound developed in the first album. The third album, "Blackbraid III," was released on August 8, 2025, continuing the project's exploration of indigenous themes and black metal aesthetics. Blackbraid has also announced a North American tour in support of "Blackbraid III," featuring supporting acts Lamp of Murmuur and Dödsrit.

bands.name: Vexed
bands.description:
Vexed is a British alternative metal band from Hertfordshire, England, formed on January 1, 2019. The band was established by vocalist Megan Targett, guitarist Jay Bacon, and drummer Willem Mason-Geraghty, who had previously played together in another band. Dissatisfied with their former group's direction, they decided to create a new project that allowed them to express themselves authentically. The name "Vexed" was inspired by the word's usage in "The Count of Monte Cristo," reflecting the band's desire to channel their frustrations into their music. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vexed_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

In April 2019, Vexed released their debut single, "Elite," featuring CJ McMahon of Thy Art Is Murder. The collaboration came about when Targett reached out to McMahon on Instagram; despite initial hesitation due to his busy schedule, he was impressed by the band's music and recorded his parts the following day. "Elite" garnered significant attention, amassing over 500,000 streams across various platforms by 2021. The band followed up with their second single, "Dominate," in May 2019. That July, they performed their first live show at the UK Tech-Fest in Newark-on-Trent. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vexed_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

In January 2021, Vexed signed with Napalm Records and released their debut album, "Culling Culture," on May 21, 2021. The album received positive reviews and featured tracks like "Hideous," "Epiphany," "Misery," and "Fake." The band performed at the 2021 Bloodstock Open Air festival and embarked on a headlining tour of the United Kingdom in January 2022. They also supported In Flames on their UK tour in March 2022 and Spiritbox on two London dates in June 2022. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vexed_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

On June 23, 2023, Vexed released their second album, "Negative Energy," which delved into themes of death, betrayal, pain, and grief. The album was produced by Meyrick de La Fuente, who also played bass on the record. Following its release, the band toured the United Kingdom in October 2023 and Europe with Cabal in January 2024. They also supported Carnifex in March and April 2024. In January and February 2025, Vexed toured Europe supporting Silent Planet, marking their first tour without label backing. The band faced financial challenges during this tour, raising funds through a GoFundMe campaign and organizing raffles to cover the remaining costs. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vexed_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

Vexed's music is characterized by a blend of alternative metal and deathcore, incorporating elements of djent, nu metal, hip-hop, and grime. Their influences include Emmure, King 810, Limp Bizkit, Megan Thee Stallion, Meshuggah, N.W.A., Thy Art Is Murder, and Veil of Maya. The band's sound has evolved over time, with "Negative Energy" showcasing a heavier and more violent approach compared to their debut album. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vexed_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

As of October 2025, Vexed continues to be active, performing live and working on new material.

bands.name: Sadistic Intent
bands.description: Sadistic Intent is an American death metal band from Los Angeles, California, formed in 1987. They are known for their aggressive and fast-paced music, blending elements of death and thrash metal. The band has released several EPs and splits, including "Impending Doom" (1990), "Resurrection" (1994), and "Ancient Black Earth" (1997). In 2007, they joined forces with Jeff Becerra to reform Possessed, contributing to the band's resurgence. In 2014, Sadistic Intent released "Reawakening Horrid Thoughts," a 12-inch laser-etched EP through Iron Pegasus Records. The current lineup includes Bay Cortez (bass, vocals), Rick Cortez (guitar), Ernesto Bueno (guitar), and Arthur Mendiola (drums).

bands.name: Sigtyr
bands.description: Sigtyr is a Norwegian black metal band formed in 1999 by Odne Røyrvik, also known as Odne Rinde. The name "Sigtyr" is derived from Old Norse, meaning "Victory in battle" or "God of Victory". Initially a one-man project, Odne released a 4-track demo titled "All Makt" in 2000. In 2002, Jan (Mordvarg) joined the project, leading to the release of three demos: "Sjelefred" in 2004, "Kulde" in 2005, and "Med Sorg Enda Soga" in 2006. In 2005, the project expanded into a full band with the addition of André Raunehaug (lead guitar) and Espen Bakketeig (synth) from Mistur, along with drummer Oddbjørn Engebakken. After Jan's departure in 2006 to pursue his solo project Feigd, Odne continued Sigtyr as a one-man band. The band's music is characterized by a blend of black, folk, and viking metal elements, drawing inspiration from the Sognametal scene, which includes bands like Windir, Vreid, and Mistur. Sigtyr's discography includes the demos "Sjelefred" (2004), "Kulde" (2005), and "Med Sorg Enda Soga" (2006).

members.name: Odne Røyrvik
members.role: Vocals, Guitars, Bass, Synth, Programming, Additional Instruments

bands.name: Cabal
bands.description: Cabal is a Danish deathcore band formed in Copenhagen in 2015. They are known for their visceral and doom-laden atmosphere, blending elements of black and death metal with djent and hardcore influences. The band released their debut album, "Mark of Rot," in 2018, followed by "Drag Me Down" in 2020, both through Long Branch Records. In 2021, they signed with Nuclear Blast and released "Magno Interitus" in 2022. Their fourth album, "Everything Rots," was released in March 2025. Cabal has performed at renowned festivals such as Copenhell, Roskilde Festival, Euroblast Festival, and Complexity Fest, and has toured in Europe, Japan, and North America.

bands.name: Hollywood Undead
bands.description: Hollywood Undead is an American rap rock band from Los Angeles, California, formed in 2005. The band is known for its energetic performances and distinctive masks, with members adopting pseudonyms such as J-Dog, Funny Man, Johnny 3 Tears, Charlie Scene, and Danny. Their debut album, "Swan Songs," was released on September 2, 2008, followed by "Desperate Measures," a live CD/DVD, on November 10, 2009. Their second studio album, "American Tragedy," came out on April 5, 2011. In 2022, they released their eighth studio album, "Hotel Kalifornia," featuring singles like "Chaos," "Wild in These Streets," and "City of the Dead." The band's music blends elements of rap rock, nu metal, and hard rock, appealing to a diverse audience. They have sold over 2 million records in the United States and approximately 3 million worldwide. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hollywood_Undead?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: The Hardkiss
bands.description: The Hardkiss is a Ukrainian rock band formed in 2011, known for their dynamic performances and fusion of rock, electronic, and progressive pop elements. The band was founded by vocalist Julia Sanina and guitarist Valeriy Bebko, who initially performed as a duo named Val & Sanina. They later expanded their lineup to include bassist Klym Lysiuk and drummer Yevhen Kibeliev. The Hardkiss gained prominence with their debut single "Babylon" in 2011, followed by the release of their first music video for "Dance with Me" in December of the same year. In 2012, they were nominated for the MTV Europe Music Award for Best Ukrainian Act. Their debut album, "Stones and Honey," released in 2014, received critical acclaim and won the YUNA award for Best Music Album in 2015. The band continued to evolve with subsequent releases, including the EP "Cold Altair" in 2015, the album "Perfection Is a Lie" in 2017, and "Залізна ластівка" in 2018. In 2021, they released "Жива і не залізна," showcasing their versatility and growth as artists. The Hardkiss has been recognized with multiple awards, including Best Rock Band at the YUNA awards in 2017, 2018, 2019, 2021, and 2022. They have also been honored as the Best Alternative Project at the M1 Music Awards in 2016, 2017, and 2018. The band's music often features a blend of Ukrainian and English lyrics, reflecting their cultural heritage and international appeal. Their energetic live performances have earned them a dedicated fan base both in Ukraine and internationally. In 2022, following the Russian invasion of Ukraine, The Hardkiss actively supported humanitarian efforts, donating proceeds from their work and performing charity concerts. In 2025, they released the single "Crush," followed by "Tenderness," both accompanied by music videos, indicating their ongoing commitment to creating impactful music.

bands.name: Sovereign
bands.description: Sovereign is a black metal band formed in 2011 in Phoenix, Arizona. The band is known for its anti-cosmic Satanism themes, exploring subjects such as death, hate, and suicide. They have released music under Vendetta Records, though specific album details are not readily available. The band's status is currently unknown, and there is limited information about their current lineup.

bands.name: Seething Akira
bands.description: Seething Akira is a six-piece electronic nu-core band from Portsmouth, UK, formed in 2012. They blend elements of metal, electronic music, and rap to create a distinctive sound. Their debut album, "Sleepy Skeletor," was released in 2018, followed by "Dysfunctional Wonderland" in 2021. In 2022, they released "Nozomi," featuring singles like "Metaphors" and "Stars." In 2024, they released "Cancel Estate," showcasing their genre-defying style. ([jacemediamusic.com](https://jacemediamusic.com/2024/10/01/seething-akira-strikes-hard-with-cancel-estate-a-genre-smashing-triumph/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: DArtagnan
bands.description: DArtagnan is a German folk rock band from Nuremberg, formed in 2015. The band's name references the 17th-century French soldier Charles de Batz de Castelmore d'Artagnan, made famous by Alexandre Dumas in his novel "The Three Musketeers." The group was founded by singer Benjamin Metzner, who also plays the mandolin, bagpipes, and flute; guitarist and background singer Felix Fischer; and guitarist and singer Tim Bernard. Metzner and Fischer, friends since their youth, previously played together in the medieval rock band Feuerschwanz. In December 2017, Fischer departed from both Feuerschwanz and DArtagnan, citing personal differences. He was replaced by Gustavo Strauss, who introduced the violin to the band's sound. DArtagnan describes their musical style as "musketeer rock," blending modern rock sounds with folk rhythms and lyrics celebrating love of life, compassion, friendship, camaraderie, and courage. Their discography includes: 1. "Seit an Seit" (2016) 2. "Verehrt und verdammt" (2017) 3. "In jener Nacht" (2019) 4. "Feuer & Flamme" (2021) 5. "Felsenfest" (2022) 6. "Herzblut" (2024) The band has also collaborated with Candice Night from Blackmore's Night on the single "We're Gonna Be Drinking" from "Felsenfest" (2022).

bands.name: Wohnout
bands.description: Wohnout is a Czech alternative rock band formed in Prague in 1988. The group comprises guitarists/vocalists Matěj Homola and Jan Homola, bassist Jiří Zeman, and drummer Zdeněk Steiner. They are among the most popular bands in the Czech Republic, having released nine studio albums since their formation. Their music is characterized by a blend of punk rock, alternative rock, and funk rock elements. Their debut album, "Cundalla," was recorded in 1998 and released in 1999 by Sony Music/Bonton. Their popularity rose with the release of "Zlý Noty Na Večeři" in 2001, which hinted at their typical melodic rock style. They have since released several albums, including "Pedro Se Vrací" (2002), "Rande s Panem Bendou" (2004), "Polib si Dědu" (2006), "Karton Veverek" (2009), "Našim klientům" (2011), "Laskonky a kremrole" (2014), "Miss maringotka" (2018), and "HUH!" (2021). Their most recent single, "Kopřivy," was released on October 17, 2025. ([music.apple.com](https://music.apple.com/us/artist/wohnout/258698488?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Chelsea Grin
bands.description: Chelsea Grin is an American deathcore band from Salt Lake City, Utah, formed in 2007. The group has released two EPs and seven full-length albums, with their most recent, "Suffer in Heaven," released on March 17, 2023. The band's lineup has undergone several changes over the years, with bassist David Flinn being the only constant member on all studio albums. Their musical style is primarily deathcore, with influences from doom and black metal, as well as technical guitar playing. Chelsea Grin has cited bands such as Suicide Silence, Whitechapel, Bury Your Dead, Emmure, American Me, Slayer, Megadeth, A Perfect Circle, and Scars of Tomorrow as their influences.

bands.name: Neonfly
bands.description: Neonfly is a British metal band formed in 2008 by guitarist and composer Frederick Thunder. The band's lineup has evolved over the years, with current members including Frederick Thunder (guitar), Paul Miller (bass), Willy Norton (vocals), and Declan Brown (drums). They have released three studio albums: 'Outshine the Sun' (2011), 'Strangers in Paradise' (2014), and 'The Future, Tonight' (2021). Their music blends elements of metal and rock, characterized by hard-hitting riffs, big metal grooves, and socially conscious lyrics. In 2024, they released a live EP titled 'Master Tapes – 10 Years Live at Masters of Rock,' commemorating their decade-long journey since their first captivating performance on the international stage. ([moshville.co.uk](https://www.moshville.co.uk/news/video/2024/06/neonfly-release-new-ep-and-video/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Tailgunner
bands.description: Tailgunner is a British heavy metal band formed in January 2022 by bassist Tom Hewson. Drawing inspiration from classic New Wave of British Heavy Metal (N.W.O.B.H.M.) bands like Iron Maiden, Judas Priest, and Motörhead, they aim to revive the traditional heavy metal sound. The band's name is inspired by the Iron Maiden song "Tailgunner." In 2022, they released their debut EP, "Crashdive," produced by Olof Wikström of Enforcer, and embarked on the "Hell's Vagabonds" UK tour. Their debut full-length album, "Guns for Hire," was released on July 14, 2023, via Fireflash Records, charting at #50 on the UK independent album charts. The album features tracks like "New Horizons," showcasing their heavy riffs and catchy hooks. In September 2025, Tailgunner signed with Napalm Records, with Judas Priest's K.K. Downing taking on the role of producer for their upcoming sophomore album. The current lineup includes lead vocalist Craig Cairns, guitarists Zach Salvini and Rhea Thompson, bassist Tom Hewson, and drummer Eddie Mariotti.

bands.name: Vended
bands.description: Vended is an American nu metal band from Des Moines, Iowa, formed in 2018. The group comprises Griffin Taylor (vocals), Simon Crahan (drums), Cole Espeland (lead guitar), and Jeremiah Pugh (bass). Notably, Taylor and Crahan are the sons of Slipknot members Corey Taylor and Shawn "Clown" Crahan, respectively. Their music is characterized by aggressive guitars, punchy rhythms, and confident vocals that reflect the struggles and realities of life. Vended released their debut EP, "What Is It//Kill It," in November 2021, featuring singles like "Asylum" and "Burn My Misery." In September 2024, they released their self-titled debut album, produced by Chris Collier, which includes tracks such as "Am I the Only One," "The Far Side," and "Nihilism." The album showcases their relentless energy and ferocity, marking a significant step in their musical journey. In September 2025, guitarist Connor Grodzicki departed the band for personal reasons.

bands.name: Finntroll
bands.description: Finntroll is a Finnish folk metal band formed in Helsinki in 1997. The band was co-founded by vocalist Jan "Katla" Jämsén and guitarist Teemu "Somnium" Raimoranta. They are known for blending elements of black metal and death metal with Finnish folk music, particularly the "humppa" style, creating a unique and energetic sound. Their lyrics are predominantly in Swedish, reflecting the Swedish-speaking minority in Finland. Finntroll's debut album, "Midnattens Widunder," released in 1999, was an underground hit, paving the way for future success. The band's discography includes several notable albums: "Jaktens Tid" (2001), "Nattfödd" (2004), "Ur Jordens Djup" (2007), "Nifelvind" (2010), "Blodsvept" (2013), and "Vredesvävd" (2020). They have also been featured in major metal festivals, including multiple appearances at 70000tons of Metal. The current lineup consists of Samuli "Skrymer" Ponsimaa (guitar), Henri "Trollhorn" Sorvali (keyboard), Sami "Tundra" Uusitalo (bass), Mikael "Routa" Karlbom (guitar), Aleksi Virta (drums), and Mathias "Vreth" Lillmåns (vocals).

bands.name: Hidden Intent
bands.description: Hidden Intent is an Australian thrash metal band formed in Adelaide in 2011. The band was established by vocalist and bassist Chris McEwen and guitarist Phil Bennett. They are known for their energetic live performances and a sound that blends elements of Bay Area and Teutonic thrash metal. Their discography includes the demo "Walking Through Hell" (2013), the full-length albums "Fear, Prey, Demise" (2018) and "Dead End Destiny" (2021), and the EP "Terrorform" (2025). The current lineup consists of Chris McEwen (vocals, bass), Phil Bennett (guitars, backing vocals), and Paul Lewis (drums, backing vocals). ([hiddenintentofficial.com](https://hiddenintentofficial.com/band/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Primordial
bands.description: Primordial is an Irish extreme metal band formed in 1993 in Skerries, County Dublin. The band was established by bassist Pól MacAmhlaigh and guitarist Ciarán MacUiliam, who had previously played together since 1987. They were later joined by vocalist Alan Averill "Nemtheanga" in 1991. Initially, the band played a mix of thrash and death metal, covering bands like Death and Sepultura. However, after Nemtheanga's addition, they shifted towards a darker direction, drawing influences from Bathory, Celtic Frost, and the emerging Norwegian black metal scene. In 1993, they released their first demo, "Dark Romanticism," marking them as one of the first black metal bands in Ireland. Their debut album, "Imrama," was released in 1995 under Cacophonous Records. Over the years, Primordial's sound has evolved, blending black metal with Celtic and folk elements, creating a unique style that reflects their Irish heritage. Their discography includes notable albums such as "To the Nameless Dead" (2007), "Redemption at the Puritan's Hand" (2011), "Where Greater Men Have Fallen" (2014), "Exile Amongst the Ruins" (2018), and "How It Ends" (2023). The band's music often explores themes of cultural heritage, history, and struggle, resonating with a global audience.

bands.name: The Pretty Reckless
bands.description: The Pretty Reckless is an American rock band from New York City, formed in 2009. The band consists of Taylor Momsen (lead vocals, rhythm guitar), Ben Phillips (lead guitar, backing vocals), Mark Damon (bass), and Jamie Perkins (drums). Initially, the band was known as The Reckless but changed their name due to trademark issues. They played their first concert on May 5, 2009, at The Annex in New York. The original lineup included Momsen, John Secolo (guitar), Matt Chiarelli (bass), and Nick Carbone (drums). In early 2009, they recorded demos and opened for The Veronicas on their North American tour. After working with various producers, Momsen met Kato Khandwala, who introduced her to Ben Phillips. Together, they began writing songs, leading to the formation of the current lineup. The Pretty Reckless released their debut studio album, "Light Me Up," in August 2010, which included the successful single "Make Me Wanna Die." Their second album, "Going to Hell," released in March 2014, featured the chart-topping singles "Heaven Knows" and "Messed Up World (F'd Up World)." In October 2016, they released "Who You Selling For," which included the single "Take Me Down." Their fourth album, "Death by Rock and Roll," was released in February 2021, with the title track becoming their seventh number-one single on the Mainstream Rock chart. In August 2025, they released "For I Am Death," their first new song in four years, and announced a Christmas EP titled "Taylor Momsen's Pretty Reckless Christmas," set for release on October 31, 2025.

bands.name: Mysticum
bands.description: Mysticum is a pioneering Norwegian industrial black metal band formed in 1992 in Asker, Norway. Initially known as Sabazios, they changed their name to Mysticum in 1993 following the release of their demo "Medusa's Tears." The band is renowned for blending traditional black metal elements with industrial sounds, creating a unique and aggressive musical style. Their debut album, "In the Streams of Inferno," released in 1996, is considered a seminal work in the industrial black metal genre. After a lengthy hiatus, Mysticum returned in 2014 with their second album, "Planet Satan," which further solidified their influence in the metal scene. The band's lyrics often explore themes of occultism, Satanism, and darkness, reflecting their rebellious and defiant artistic vision.

bands.name: Final Cry
bands.description: Final Cry is a German metal band formed in 1989 in Lower Saxony. Initially known as Parricide, they changed their name to Final Cry in 1992. The band has released six albums, with their latest, "The Ever-Rest," released in March 2022. Their music blends elements of 80s speed and thrash metal with 90s Scandinavian death and black metal, characterized by powerful, fast metal with sharp riffs, melody, and atmosphere. The band has sold over 10,000 records and remains deeply rooted in the underground scene. ([finalcry.de](https://finalcry.de/band.html?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Kreator
bands.description: Kreator is a German thrash metal band formed in Essen in 1982. Initially known as Metal Militia, Tyrant, and Tormentor, they adopted the name Kreator in 1984. The original lineup featured lead vocalist and guitarist Mille Petrozza, drummer Jürgen "Ventor" Reil, and bassist Rob Fioretti. Their debut album, "Endless Pain," released in 1985, combined elements of black metal, death metal, and thrash metal, drawing inspiration from bands like Venom, Mercyful Fate, and Bathory. The 1986 album "Pleasure to Kill" is considered a thrash classic and significantly influenced the death metal genre. Over the years, Kreator's musical style has evolved, incorporating industrial and gothic elements, as seen in their 1992 album "Renewal." In 2001, they returned to their thrash roots with "Violent Revolution," marking the beginning of a thrash metal revival. Their upcoming sixteenth studio album, "Krushers of the World," is set for release on January 16, 2026, via Nuclear Blast Records. The current lineup includes Mille Petrozza, Jürgen "Ventor" Reil, Sami Yli-Sirniö, and Frédéric Leclercq.

bands.name: Six Feet Under
bands.description: Six Feet Under is an American death metal band formed in 1993 in Tampa, Florida. The band was established by former Cannibal Corpse vocalist Chris Barnes and guitarist Allen West. Known for their heavy, groove-laden sound, Six Feet Under has been a significant presence in the death metal scene. Their lyrical themes often explore topics such as gore, death, murder, politics, and cannabis. The band's discography includes notable albums like "Haunted" (1995), "Warpath" (1997), and "Maximum Violence" (1999). They have also released cover albums, such as "Graveyard Classics" series, showcasing their interpretations of classic rock and metal songs. As of 2024, the lineup includes Chris Barnes (vocals), Jeff Hughell (bass), and Jack Owen (guitar). Six Feet Under continues to tour and release new material, maintaining their status as a staple in the death metal genre.

bands.name: Kupfergold
bands.description:
Kupfergold is a German folk-rock band formed in 2018, known for their unique blend of medieval folk, rock, and humorous live performances. Originating from Cologne, North Rhine-Westphalia, the band was established by Bonnie Banks (vocals), Eric Rhymes (acoustic guitar, vocals), and Bummbummbasti (drums, percussion). The name 'Kupfergold' is derived from the hair colors of the founding members, Bonnie and Eric, who had been performing as a duo under this name since 2010. ([de.wikipedia.org](https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kupfergold?utm_source=openai))

Initially, Kupfergold's music was characterized by acoustic instruments such as the lute and acoustic guitar, accompanied by percussion and multi-part vocals. Their early performances were primarily at medieval markets, live-action role-playing events, and online concerts. In 2019, they released their first album, "Koboldkeile," showcasing their Irish folk influences. This was followed by "Heiliger Bimbatz" in 2021, featuring original compositions. In 2023, they collaborated with Mr. Hurley & die Pulveraffen on the carnival feature "Leuchtturm op Kölsch." The band's second studio album, "Lichtermeer," released in 2024, marked a significant evolution in their sound, incorporating electric guitars and a full drum kit, leading to a more rock-oriented style. This album was supported by their first headlining tour of the same name. In 2025, Kupfergold released "Fasan Alarm," which debuted at number 14 on the German album charts, solidifying their position in the German music scene. ([de.wikipedia.org](https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kupfergold?utm_source=openai))

Kupfergold's music is self-described as "Assi-Folk," a mix of party music, storytelling, and anarchic humor. Their lyrics often explore themes from fantasy, pub life, everyday absurdities, and subculture scenes. The band has been active in the German medieval, role-playing, and festival scenes, performing at notable events such as the Wacken Open Air and Summer Breeze festivals. ([de.wikipedia.org](https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kupfergold?utm_source=openai))

As of 2025, the lineup includes Bonnie Banks (vocals), Eric Rhymes (acoustic guitar, vocals), Bummbummbasti (drums, percussion), Kai der Hai (bass), and Flint Stone (electric guitar, vocals). ([de.wikipedia.org](https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kupfergold?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Battlesnake
bands.description: Battlesnake is an Australian metal band from Sydney, formed in 2017. The band consists of vocalist and guitarist Sam Frank, guitarists Ben Frank and Daniel Willington, drummer Nick Zammit, bassist Elliott Hitchcock, and keytarist Billy O'key. They are known for their unique blend of hard and progressive rock and metal, drawing inspiration from fantasy and sci-fi themes, with influences from bands like Queen, King Gizzard & the Lizard Wizard, Judas Priest, and AC/DC. Their music features themes of wizards, dragons, and epic tales, delivered comedically while paying homage to classic heavy metal. They are also known for high-energy live performances with extravagant staging and costume design. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battlesnake?utm_source=openai)) Their discography includes the debut EP "Myths and Legends from Gorbag's Domain" (2020), the self-titled album "Battlesnake" (2023), and "The Rise and Demise of the Motorsteeple" (2024). In 2025, they released their third studio album, "Dawn of the Exultants and the Hunt for the Shepherd," and embarked on an international tour across the UK and Europe. ([metalshockfinland.com](https://metalshockfinland.com/2025/06/08/battlesnake-release-new-album-dawn-of-the-exultants-and-the-hunt-for-the-shepherd/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Stampin' Ground
bands.description: Stampin' Ground is a British metalcore band from Cheltenham, England, formed in 1995. They are known for their aggressive and heavy sound, blending elements of groove metal and thrash metal. The band has toured with notable acts such as Anthrax, Chimaira, The Haunted, Agnostic Front, Sick of It All, Soulfly, and Arch Enemy, and played the main stage at Download Festival in 2003. Their discography includes several releases: "Demons Run Amok" (1997), "An Expression of Repressed Violence" (1998), "Carved from Empty Words" (2000), "A New Darkness Upon Us" (2003), and a self-titled album (1999). In 2024, they announced their participation in the Damnation Festival 2025, celebrating the 25th anniversary of "Carved from Empty Words". The current lineup features Scott Atkins on guitar, Adam Frakes-Sime on vocals, Neil Hutton on drums, Ben Frost on bass, and Paul Fletcher on guitar.

bands.name: Auðn
bands.description:
Auðn is an Icelandic atmospheric black metal band formed in 2010 in the village of Hveragerði. The band's name translates to "desolation" in Icelandic, reflecting the bleak and haunting themes present in their music. Their sound is characterized by melodic and atmospheric elements, setting them apart from the more abrasive styles within the black metal genre. The quintet's lineup includes Hjalti Sveinsson on vocals, Aðalsteinn Magnússon and Andri Björn Birgisson on guitars, Hjálmar Gylfason on bass, and Sigurður Kjartan Pálsson on drums.

The band's self-titled debut album was released in 2014 through Metallic Media and Black Plague Records. This was followed by their second album, "Farvegir Fyrndar," in 2017, which saw them sign with the French independent label Season of Mist. Their third full-length album, "Vökudraumsins Fangi," was released on October 30, 2020, featuring the track "Ljóstýra," which delves into themes of loneliness and the search for hope in a desolate world. The album's cover artwork was created by Mýrmann.

Auðn's music often explores themes of depression, loss, and nature, with lyrics sung in Icelandic. Their atmospheric compositions have garnered critical acclaim, with reviewers praising their ability to create immersive and emotionally resonant soundscapes. The band has performed at notable festivals, including the Wacken Open Air in 2016 and 2022, and the Summer Breeze festival in 2018, showcasing their growing presence in the international metal scene.

bands.name: Warkings
bands.description: Warkings is a power metal band formed in 2018 by Serenity vocalist Georg Neuhauser and members of Souldrinker and Watch Me Bleed. The band is known for their thematic focus on warriors and war, delivering anthemic power metal with a cinematic flair. Their discography includes five studio albums: 'Reborn' (2018), 'Revenge' (2020), 'Revolution' (2021), 'Morgana' (2022), and 'Armageddon' (2025). The 2025 album features collaborations with artists like Dominum, Orden Ogan, and Subway to Sally. Warkings has toured extensively, sharing stages with bands such as Powerwolf, HammerFall, and Subway to Sally, and performing at major festivals including Wacken Open Air.

bands.name: Amenra
bands.description: Amenra is a Belgian post-metal band formed in 1999 in Kortrijk, West Flanders. The band was founded by vocalist Colin H. van Eeckhout and guitarist Mathieu Vandekerckhove, who had previously been part of the hardcore punk band Spineless. Seeking to create music with more "heart and soul," they established Amenra. Over the years, the lineup expanded to include drummer Bjorn J. Lebon, guitarist Lennart Bossu, and bassist Amy Tung Barrysmith. Amenra's music is characterized by brooding atmospheres and spiritual intensity, blending elements of doom metal, hardcore punk, and post-rock. Their live performances, often accompanied by visual art, have been described as "entrancing communions." The band has released several studio albums, including "Mass III" (2005), "Mass IV" (2008), "Mass V" (2012), "Mass VI" (2017), and "De Doorn" (2021). "De Doorn" debuted at No. 3 on the Belgian Album Chart and marked their first album on the American label Relapse Records. In 2025, Amenra released two EPs, "De Toorn" and "Of Fang and Claw," showcasing their continued evolution in the post-metal genre.

bands.name: Hammer King
bands.description: Hammer King is a German heavy and power metal band formed in 2015 in Kaiserslautern, Rhineland-Palatinate. The band was founded by vocalist and guitarist Titan Fox V, formerly of Ross The Boss, alongside guitarist Gino Wilde, bassist K.K. Basement, and drummer Dolph A. Macallan. Their music is characterized by epic fantasy themes and a heavy metal sound reminiscent of classic traditions. Their debut album, "Kingdom of the Hammer King," was released in 2015, followed by "King Is Rising" in 2016, "Poseidon Will Carry Us Home" in 2018, "Hammer King" in 2021, "Kingdemonium" in 2022, and "König und Kaiser" in 2024. In 2025, they released "Make Metal Royal Again," featuring tracks like "King For A Day" and "Schlaf Kaiser schlaf." The current lineup includes Titan Fox V (vocals & guitar), Gino Wilde (guitar), Günt von Schratenau (bass), and Count Ivo Shandor of Shandoria (drums). ([hammer-king.com](https://hammer-king.com/band/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Bootyard Bandits
bands.description: Bootyard Bandits are a heavy country rock band from Worcester, England, formed in 2019. They blend heavy riffs with country licks, creating a distinctive Americana aesthetic. Their debut single, "Hoedown Showdown," gained attention through a comically gruesome Lego stop-motion video. The band has toured extensively, supporting pirate metal band Alestorm across Europe and the UK, and have been compared to Blackstone Cherry for their musicality and Steel Panther for their tongue-in-cheek lyrics. In 2021, they released their debut album, "Songs For The Saddle Sore," followed by more extensive touring. In late 2025, they introduced a new lineup featuring ex-members of The Defiled and Heaven's Basement, and announced a highly anticipated album scheduled for release in late 2025. Their music is influenced by artists ranging from Guns N' Roses to Brad Paisley, Bring Me The Horizon to Dolly Parton, with the metal being more metal and the country being more country.

bands.name: Havukruunu
bands.description: Havukruunu is a Finnish pagan black metal band formed in 2005 in Hausjärvi, Kanta-Häme. Originally known as Talvikuu, meaning "wintermoon," they adopted the name Havukruunu, translating to "coniferous crown," to reflect their deep connection to Finnish nature and pagan traditions. The band's music is characterized by raw, bleak, and unforgiving heavy metal, infused with elements from the misty Finnish forests. Their lyrics often explore themes of darkness, loneliness, sadness, winter, and Finnish paganism. Havukruunu's discography includes several notable releases. Their debut album, "Havulinnaan," was released in 2015 and reissued in 2025. The album received positive reviews for its blend of black metal and folk melodies. In 2020, they released "Uinuos Syömein Sota," followed by "Havukruunu ja Talvenvarjo" in 2022. Their latest album, "Tavastland," was released on February 28, 2025, via Svart Records. "Tavastland" is based on the ancient story of Tavastland and the events of 1237, where the Tavastians rebelled against the Church, driving the popes into the frost to die. The album offers the primeval spirit of Havukruunu, featuring blistering guitar solos and glorious riffs that harken to the past. The current lineup consists of Stefa (vocals, guitars, keyboards, percussion, songwriting, lyrics), Humö (bass), Kostajainen (drums), and Henka (guitars).

members.name: Stefa
members.role: Vocals, Guitars, Keyboards, Percussion, Songwriting, Lyrics

bands.name: Urn
bands.description: Urn is a Finnish black and thrash metal band formed in 1994 in Kuopio, Finland. Initially, the band was a side project to their main group, Flame. The lineup included Simo "Blackvenom" Rouvinen on vocals and guitar, Mikko "Pimeä" Äimälä on drums, and Kaitsu "Infernus" Pekkarnen on bass. They released their first demo, "Urn of Blood," in 2007, followed by "The Conquered Are Burned" in 2010. In 2017, Urn made a comeback with the album "The Burning," released through Dark Moon Records. The album features tracks like "Morbid Black Sorrow" and "Sons of the Northern Star," showcasing their signature blend of black and thrash metal. The band signed with Season of Mist in October 2018, with plans to release a new album in 2019. ([season-of-mist.com](https://www.season-of-mist.com/news/urn-2018-10-02/?utm_source=openai)) Urn's music is characterized by aggressive riffs, dark atmospheres, and themes exploring darkness and consciousness. Their discography includes "The Burning" (2017), "Soul Destroyers" (2018), "Dawn of the Devastation" (2019), "Morbid Death" (2020), and "666 Megatons" (2021). ([urn-official.bandcamp.com](https://urn-official.bandcamp.com/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Hellripper
bands.description: Hellripper is a one-man black/speed metal band formed by Scottish musician James McBain in 2014. Drawing inspiration from black metal bands like Venom and Darkthrone, thrash metal acts such as Megadeth and Metallica, and punk-oriented groups like Motörhead and Anti-Cimex, Hellripper's music is characterized by fast tempos, aggressive riffs, and themes of witchcraft, the occult, and Satanism. Lyrically, the band often delves into historical events, such as the possession of Anneliese Michel in the song "Anneliese" and the Affair of the Poisons in the track "The Affair of the Poisons." The band's discography includes the debut EP "The Manifestation of Evil" (2015), the full-length album "Coagulating Darkness" (2017), the EP "Black Arts & Alchemy" (2019), and the album "The Affair of the Poisons" (2020). In 2023, Hellripper released "Warlocks Grim & Withered Hags," a record centered around Scottish folklore and history. In August 2025, the band signed with Century Media Records, with plans to release new material in early 2026. Hellripper's music has been praised for its energetic tempo and homage to early-'80s thrash and black metal, with critics highlighting its unrelenting and balls-out metal style.

bands.name: Miracle Of Sound
bands.description: Miracle Of Sound is the musical project of Irish multi-instrumentalist and songwriter Gavin Dunne, born on May 6, 1980, in Cork, Ireland. Dunne began his musical journey with the band Lotus Lullaby, which won the Bank of Ireland National Student Music Awards in 2006. After the band's dissolution, he embarked on a solo career, creating music inspired by video games, films, and TV shows. His debut album, "Level 1," was released in 2011, followed by "Level 2" in 2012, "Level 3" in 2013, "Level 4" in 2013, "Level 5" in 2014, "Vistas" in 2014, "Metal Up" in 2015, "Level 6" in 2015, "Level 7" in 2016, "Level 8" in 2017, "Level 9" in 2018, "Level 10" in 2019, "Level 11" in 2020, and "Level 12" in 2023. In 2024, he released "Materia (Best Of 2011 – 2024)," his first physical album, showcasing his diverse musical styles, including symphonic metal, rock, and electronic elements. Dunne's music has garnered over a billion streams across platforms, with his viral hit "Valhalla Calling" amassing over 120 million streams. He has collaborated with industry giants like Ubisoft, Bioware, EA, and Bethesda for titles such as "Mass Effect," "Assassin’s Creed," "Wasteland 2," and "Watch Dogs." ([label.napalmrecords.com](https://label.napalmrecords.com/miracle-of-sound?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Wardruna
bands.description:
Wardruna is a Norwegian music group formed in 2003 by Einar "Kvitrafn" Selvik, Gaahl, and Lindy-Fay Hella. Dedicated to creating musical renditions of Norse cultural and esoteric traditions, they make significant use of Nordic historical and traditional instruments, including deer-hide frame drums, flutes, kraviklyra, tagelharpe, mouth harp, goat horn, and lur. Non-traditional instruments and other sources of sound like trees, rocks, water, and torches are also used. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wardruna?utm_source=openai)) Their discography includes:

- "Runaljod – Gap Var Ginnunga" (2009)
- "Runaljod – Yggdrasil" (2013)
- "Runaljod – Ragnarok" (2016)
- "Skald" (2018)
- "Kvitravn" (2021)
- "Birna" (2025)

"Birna" is scheduled for release on January 24, 2025, through Sony Music and By Norse. ([wardruna.com](https://www.wardruna.com/about/index.html?utm_source=openai))

Wardruna's music has been featured in the TV series "Vikings," contributing to the show's atmospheric and thematic depth. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wardruna?utm_source=openai))

The band's name, "Wardruna," translates to "the guardian of secrets" or "she who whispers," reflecting their dedication to preserving and reviving ancient Norse traditions through music. ([talharpa.org](https://www.talharpa.org/listing/wardruna/?utm_source=openai))

For more information, visit their official website at [wardruna.com](https://wardruna.com/).

bands.name: Gridiron
bands.description: Gridiron is an American metal band formed in 2020, known for their aggressive and dynamic sound that blends elements of hardcore and metal. The band emerged during the COVID-19 pandemic, bringing together members from the thriving hardcore scenes in Philadelphia, Delaware, and Michigan. Their music is characterized by heavy riffs, intense rhythms, and powerful vocals, reflecting the raw energy of their live performances. In November 2024, Gridiron signed with Blue Grape Music, a label that has also signed bands like Code Orange and GEL. Shortly after, they released their single "Talk Real," which showcases their evolving sound and commitment to pushing the boundaries of heavy music. The single was well-received, with vocalist Mathew Karll describing it as a call to action, emphasizing the importance of unity and readiness. In August 2025, the band released "Gridiron (Audiotree Live Version) - EP," featuring live renditions of their tracks, capturing the essence of their live shows. The EP includes six songs that highlight the band's versatility and stage presence. Gridiron has been active in the live music scene, performing at various venues and festivals. They were confirmed for Sonic Temple in Columbus, Ohio, and have shared stages with bands like Trapped Under Ice. Their music is available on platforms like Apple Music and SoundCloud, where fans can listen to tracks such as "Heavy Metal Money (Seen It All Before)" and "Best Served Cold." Gridiron's lineup includes vocalist Mathew Karll, guitarist Will Kaelin, bassist Xavier Wilson, guitarist William Livesay, and drummer Tyler Mullen. Together, they continue to make a significant impact in the metal and hardcore scenes, earning acclaim for their energetic performances and evolving sound.

bands.name: Alcest
bands.description: Alcest is a French post-black metal band from Bagnols-sur-Cèze, founded in 2000 by Stéphane Paut, known as Neige. Initially a solo black metal project, Alcest evolved into a trio with the addition of Aegnor and Argoth, releasing their first demo, "Tristesse Hivernale," in 2001. Following the departure of Aegnor and Argoth, Neige continued Alcest as a solo endeavor, incorporating elements of shoegaze and post-metal into the band's sound. In 2009, drummer Winterhalter joined Alcest, marking a new chapter in the band's evolution. Alcest is widely credited with pioneering the "blackgaze" genre, blending black metal with shoegaze influences. Their discography includes seven studio albums, with "Les Chants de l'Aurore" released on June 21, 2024. The album received generally positive reviews and debuted at number 77 in France. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Les_Chants_de_l%27aurore?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Body Count
bands.description: Body Count is an American heavy metal band formed in Los Angeles in 1990. The group is fronted by Ice-T, who co-founded the band with lead guitarist Ernie C out of their shared interest in heavy metal music. Ice-T serves as the lead vocalist and lyricist, while Ernie C is responsible for the band's music composition. The band's self-titled debut album was released on March 31, 1992, on Sire/Warner Bros. Records. The album garnered attention due to the controversial song "Cop Killer," which was later removed from the album due to public backlash. Despite this, the album was well-received and established Body Count as a significant presence in the heavy metal scene. Over the years, the band has released several albums, including "Born Dead" (1994), "Violent Demise: The Last Days" (1997), "Murder 4 Hire" (2006), "Manslaughter" (2014), "Bloodlust" (2017), "Carnivore" (2020), and "Merciless" (2024). Their music blends elements of crossover thrash, rap metal, and hardcore punk, addressing themes such as social issues, politics, and violence. The band's lineup has evolved over time, with current members including Ice-T, Ernie C, Sean E. Sean, Vincent Price, Will "Ill Will" Dorsey Jr., Juan of the Dead, and Little Ice. Body Count continues to tour and release new music, maintaining a dedicated fan base and contributing to the heavy metal genre.

bands.name: Oomph!
bands.description: Oomph! is a German rock band from Wolfsburg, formed in 1989. They are pioneers of the Neue Deutsche Härte movement, blending industrial metal, alternative metal, and electronic body music (EBM) to create a distinctive sound. Their self-titled debut album, released in 1992, showcased their early EBM influences. Over the years, Oomph! has evolved, incorporating heavier guitar-driven metal elements while maintaining their electronic roots. Their 2004 single "Augen Auf!" became a major hit, reaching number one in Germany and marking a significant milestone in their career. In 2023, the band released their 14th studio album, "Richter und Henker," introducing new vocalist Daniel "Der" Schulz, signaling a new era for the band. The album debuted at number one on the German Album Charts, reaffirming Oomph!'s enduring influence in the metal scene. ([oomph.de](https://www.oomph.de/bio23/?utm_source=openai))

members.name: Robert "Flux" Flux
members.role: Rhythm Guitar, Samples, Bass, Backing Vocals

bands.name: Gaahls Wyrd
bands.description: Gaahls Wyrd is a Norwegian black metal band formed in 2015 by former Gorgoroth and God Seed vocalist Gaahl. The band emerged after Gaahl's departure from God Seed, with the first live performance taking place at the BlekkMetal Festival in Bergen, Norway, on November 15, 2015. The initial lineup included Gaahl on vocals, Sir on guitar, Eld on bass, and Baard Kolstad on drums. Over time, the lineup evolved, with Spektre joining as the drummer in 2017, Lust Kilman as the guitarist in 2015, and Nekroman as the bassist in 2024. Gaahls Wyrd's music is characterized by a blend of black and heavy metal elements, exploring themes of philosophy, darkness, and chaos. Their discography includes the debut album "GastiR – Ghosts Invited" (2019), the EP "The Humming Mountain" (2021), and the second album "Braiding the Stories" (2025). The band has been active in the black metal scene, performing songs from Gaahl's previous projects, including Gorgoroth and Trelldom, as well as original material. Their music is released under the Season of Mist label.

bands.name: Yonaka
bands.description: Yonaka is an English alternative rock band formed in Brighton in 2014. The group consists of vocalist Theresa Jarvis, guitarist George Edwards, and bassist Alex Crosby. They initially gained attention with their debut EP, "Heavy," released in 2017, which showcased their energetic sound blending rock and electronic elements. In 2018, they released two more EPs, "Teach Me to Fight" and "Creature," with the title track of "Creature" reaching the top spot on the Kerrang! Rock Chart in December 2018. Their debut album, "Don't Wait 'Til Tomorrow," was released on May 31, 2019, and peaked at number 38 on the UK Albums Chart. In 2021, they released "Seize the Power," the first official single from their mixtape of the same name, marking a new chapter in their musical journey. The band's music is characterized by a dynamic blend of alternative rock, pop energy, punk grit, and hip-hop edge, addressing themes of mental health, empowerment, and staying grounded in the present. They have been praised for their electrifying live performances and have garnered a dedicated fan base.

bands.name: Sacred Reich
bands.description: Sacred Reich is an American thrash metal band formed in Phoenix, Arizona, in 1985. The original lineup consisted of vocalist Dan Kelly, bassist Mike Andre, guitarist Jeff Martinek, guitarist Jason Rainey, and drummer Ray Nay. After Kelly's departure due to illness, Phil Rind took over as bassist and vocalist. The band's music is characterized by mid-tempo thrash metal with influences from punk rock and hardcore punk, often addressing political and social issues in their lyrics. Their debut album, "Ignorance," released in 1987, was followed by "The American Way" in 1990, which peaked at No. 153 on the Billboard 200 chart. After a hiatus from 2000 to 2006, Sacred Reich reunited and released "Awakening" in 2019. In October 2025, the band announced the departure of drummer Dave McClain and the upcoming release of their sixth studio album, "Into the Abyss," scheduled for spring 2026. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sacred_Reich?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Down
bands.description: Down is an American heavy metal supergroup formed in 1991 in New Orleans, Louisiana. The band comprises vocalist Phil Anselmo (Pantera, Superjoint Ritual), guitarist Pepper Keenan (Corrosion of Conformity), guitarist Kirk Windstein (Crowbar), drummer Jimmy Bower (Eyehategod, Superjoint Ritual), and bassist Pat Bruders (Goatwhore). Their music blends elements of sludge metal and southern metal, characterized by heavy, groove-laden riffs and introspective lyrics. Down's debut album, "NOLA," released in 1995, received critical acclaim and debuted at number 55 on the Billboard 200. The band has since released several studio albums, including "Down II: A Bustle in Your Hedgerow" (2002), "Down III: Over the Under" (2007), and two EPs, "Down IV – Part I" (2012) and "Down IV – Part II" (2014). In January 2025, Down began recording their first album in 17 years, with plans for a 2026 release. They signed with Nuclear Blast Records in 2024 to release this upcoming album. The band's official website is down-nola.com.

bands.name: Saxon
bands.description: Saxon is a British heavy metal band formed in Barnsley, England, in 1975. Initially known as Son of a Bitch, they adopted the name Saxon in 1979. As pioneers of the New Wave of British Heavy Metal (NWOBHM), Saxon achieved significant success in the 1980s, with eight UK Top 40 albums, including four in the Top 10 and two in the Top 5. Their music resonated across Europe, South America, Japan, and North America, solidifying their international appeal. The band's lineup has evolved over the years, with founding members Biff Byford (vocals) and Paul Quinn (guitar) remaining constants. Other key members include Nigel Glockler (drums), Nibbs Carter (bass), and Doug Scarratt (guitar). Saxon's discography is extensive, with notable albums such as "Wheels of Steel" (1980), "Strong Arm of the Law" (1980), "Denim and Leather" (1981), and "Power & the Glory" (1983). Their music is characterized by powerful vocals, driving guitar riffs, and themes often drawn from history and mythology. In recent years, Saxon has continued to release new material, including the cover album "More Inspirations" in 2023 and the studio album "Hell, Fire and Damnation" in 2024. They remain active, touring regularly and maintaining a dedicated fan base worldwide.

bands.name: Party Cannon
bands.description: Formed in 2010 in Dunfermline, Scotland, Party Cannon is a deathgrind band known for their humorous and party-centric themes. Their music blends brutal death metal with grindcore elements, creating a unique 'party slam' style. The band has released several notable works, including their debut album 'Bong Hit Hospitalisation' in 2015, the EP 'Perverse Party Platter' in 2017, and the full-length album 'Volumes of Vomit' in 2022. In 2024, they released 'Injuries Are Inevitable' under Unique Leader Records. Their discography also features singles like 'Nauseating and Unpalatable' (2021) and 'High Tariff Behaviour' (2025).

bands.name: Terror
bands.description: Terror is an American hardcore punk band from Los Angeles, California, formed in 2002. The band was established by vocalist Scott Vogel, who had previously been part of bands like Slugfest and Buried Alive, and drummer Nick Jett. They were later joined by guitarist Todd Jones and bassist Matt Smith. Terror quickly gained recognition for their energetic performances and straightforward hardcore sound. Their debut album, "One with the Underdogs," released in 2004, sold over 40,000 copies and solidified their presence in the hardcore scene. Over the years, the lineup has seen several changes, with notable additions such as guitarist Martin Stewart in 2006, lead guitarist Jordan Posner in 2009, and bassist Chris Linkovich in 2017. Despite these changes, the band has maintained its aggressive style, blending elements of hardcore punk and thrash metal. Their discography includes several studio albums, with "Pain Into Power" released in May 2022. The band is known for their relentless touring schedule, performing across Europe, Australia, New Zealand, Japan, Korea, Mexico, and South America. Their music often addresses themes of anger, rebellion, and street life, resonating with fans worldwide. Terror's commitment to their craft and their fans has made them a staple in the hardcore community.

bands.name: Celestial Sanctuary
bands.description: Formed in 2019 in Cambridge, England, Celestial Sanctuary is a death metal band that has rapidly established itself within the UK's metal scene. The lineup consists of Thomas Cronin (vocals and guitar), Matt Adnett (guitar), Jay Rutterford (bass), and James Burke (drums). Their music is characterized by a feral and aggressive style, drawing influences from bands like Carcass, Dying Fetus, and Cannibal Corpse. Their debut demo, "Mass Extinction," released in October 2019, showcased their commitment to the death metal genre. This was followed by their first full-length album, "Soul Diminished," in March 2021, which delved into themes of existentialism and the human condition. In August 2023, they released "Insatiable Thirst for Torment," further solidifying their presence in the death metal community. In June 2024, they released the EP "Visions of Stagnant Blood," which offered tracks ranging from relentless aggressive pummeling to grim and doom-laden melodic approaches. In November 2024, Celestial Sanctuary signed with Metal Blade Records, marking a significant milestone in their career. ([celestial-sanctuary.com](https://www.celestial-sanctuary.com/bio?utm_source=openai)) Their discography reflects a dedication to evolving the death metal genre while maintaining its core elements.

bands.name: Breaking Benjamin
bands.description: Breaking Benjamin is an American rock band from Wilkes-Barre, Pennsylvania, formed in 1999 by lead vocalist and guitarist Benjamin Burnley. The band's original lineup included guitarist Aaron Fink, bassist Mark James Klepaski, and drummer Jeremy Hummel. They released their self-titled EP in 2001, which sold out 2,000 copies locally. Their major label debut, "Saturate," came in 2002, followed by "We Are Not Alone" in 2004, featuring the hit single "So Cold." In 2005, Hummel was replaced by Chad Szeliga. After a hiatus, the band reformed in 2014 with Burnley, guitarist Jasen Rauch, guitarist and backing vocalist Keith Wallen, bassist and backing vocalist Aaron Bruch, and drummer Shaun Foist. They released "Dark Before Dawn" in 2015, which debuted at number one on the Billboard 200. In 2024, they signed with BMG and released "Awaken," their first new single in five years. The band's style blends hard rock, post-grunge, and alternative metal, with Burnley's distinctive vocals and introspective lyrics.

bands.name: Dirkschneider
bands.description: Dirkschneider is a German heavy metal band formed in 2016 by Udo Dirkschneider, the former lead vocalist of Accept and current frontman of U.D.O.
